review:
I have a lot of love for this game. Played through it a couple times on console and now going through it again on PC. I fully acknowledge its shortcomings, the repetitive mission structure, all that stuff you can read about in other reviews on here, but the sixties era, the New Orleans-esque setting, the memorable characters, and the excellent story easily outweigh all of that for me.

Lincoln Clay is one of my all-time favorite game protagonists and the perspective provided by playing as a black man in the south in the 1960s makes this more than a wannabe GTA clone. If you enjoy crime stories, revenge stories, or the catharsis of shooting up a Klan gathering, give this one a shot. 

Change up your own approach to the same-y missions to keep them varied (go stealth, swap out the weapons you use, etc.) and enjoy the more fleshed out missions that cap each chapter as you tear down a criminal empire and build your own in its place. 

Not perfect, but absolutely worth a play.

review:
Mafia III is not the worst AAA to release but it is pretty bad. It's a shame because the first two hours are some of the best gaming has to offer. It's a great example of how the introduction/tutorial phase should be done, instead of bombarding you with text or teaching you the controls in the most boring way possible. The soundtrack, setting and characters are also very well done. Unfortunately that's where the good stops at, after the first two hours the "real" game play starts, and it's more or less the same thing over and over again until the end. 

At release the game was plagued by performance issues which have for the most part been fixed. Mirror reflections however are still worse than most games from the early 2000s. I only really ran into 1 bug: raising or lowering the volume (via the audio controls on my K70 LUX keyboard) caused the game to drop to 30 fps for a couple of seconds.

Get it on a DEEP sale if you don't mind repetitive game play.
gud

review:
[h1]Rating: 7.5/10[/h1]

In contrast to the majority view, I enjoyed this game thoroughly! Although I do agree that this is not a "true" Mafia game in spirit, I would treat this as a fun GTA clone set in the 60s, and that's what it is! [b]The developers spared no expense as far as modern graphics, realistic facial animations and stellar voice acting go, and that made the whole gameplay experience feel cinematic.[/b] The cinematic experience turned out to be a great incentive to run through the repetitive mission design, which I admit is something that left a lot to be desired!

To elaborate on cinematic gameplay, I would like to point out the attention to detail put to each car model that drives like it should in a game world. I am sure not many are real fans of the driving in the game, but I enjoyed driving the Exotic Vehicles that have really smooth handling! [b]As far as the action goes, the combat mechanics feel tight![/b] The feedback you get after shooting every gun in the game feels right and the visceral satisfaction you get after a brutal takedown is intense! So no complaints there!

[b]The soundtrack of the game is replete with classics for which the Mafia series is famous for.[/b] I bet in the long run some of these songs would probably be removed like they were in the original Mafia when it re-released. Nevertheless, for the time-being, I really enjoyed driving through the game world while listening to the tracks! Speaking of the tracks, the radio advertisements are great too! It made the whole experience feel more immersive.

[b]However, the lack of post end-game activities apart from the boring delivery missions and races doesn't do much for you to keep on playing the game for hours post-completion.[/b] The DLC do add a lot of value to the overall package, but if you completed them before completing the main game, you will not have anything to do but sell weed. Speaking of the DLC, all of them are great in their own right and aren't as repetitive as the main game missions! Nevertheless, I expected the Bounty Hunting missions to be continuous and wanted Sammy's to be made playable as a business which you are supposed to protect and run like a true Mafia boss. But alas, that isn't the case.

[b]So I would certainly recommend the game for the price of admission, but however the frequent discounts certainly make it a great deal you shouldn't pass out on if you like open world games![/b]

review: I actually enjoy this game but I can understand why someone might not like this game. Firstly the story is really good. Whenever you get into a cutscene and will instantly be interested in what is going on. Unfortunately I can't say the same thing about Mafia 3's gameplay. This game gets super repetitive and boring. But the gun play is super fun and switching different weapons is what makes the shooting more fun. The driving is also really good and realistic. Overall This game is a mixed bag. At times I really enjoy the game but at other times I will just be extremely bored. But the story is what will always keep you playing. If you love to go around killing people and destroying a bunch of stuff then this game will probably be for you. I also forgot to mention the dlc but its worth your money. There is a ton of great moments in the dlc for Mafia 3.

Bought this as part of the trilogy to get the Mafia 1 remaster.

At least the cut scene looked good. Absolutely no faith in Hanger 13 remastering Mafia 1.

review:
I played this game when it was free to play for 5 days
The game is amazing, I loved every second of it..

- Countryside and Bayou Fantom are such a good places to drive around and listen to great soundtracks from the game
- Driving simulation is the best of all games I played
- Gunplay fells sooo satisfying
- Story combined with music is on top
- The game nailed the 60s atmosphere
- It has some bugs, but it didn't harm my overall great impression

review: After the Definitive Edtion update the game doesn't even run well. The game was already badly optimised in the first place! I could run Watch_Dogs which is a way better looking game at a better framerate and now Mafia III doesn't even work! I wasn't able to finish the game from before and I'm not going out of my way to even fix it either. This game was bad from the start and is more of a chore to play. Before you play $30 for this game just get Watch_Dogs, Just Cause 3, Mafia II, Yakuza 0, Sleeping Dogs or Far Cry 2. If you want you can try GTA IV too which is now easier to run on newer computers but still has a few problems so it's your choice. I mainly suggest Watch_Dogs out of all of these though.

review: This game has become a guilty pleasure of mine. That's not to say I think it's GOOD. Because on a fundamental scale, it's not. It's full of bugs and I remember it often required me to exit the game completely because the dialogue wouldn't start when you interact with certain NPCs. And the gameplay is repetitive as hell. But the story is pretty interesting and kept me wanting to see what happens next. But if you're going into this expecting it to be like previous Mafia titles, you will be HEAVILY disappointed. When I first played this, I didn't know what to think. BUT, I think it's worth trying when it's on sale.

review:
Mafia lll has been a bit of a bumpy journey for me, good and bad, with mixed feelings. However, I feel the need to overall give this game a positive rating.

The setting takes places in a New Orleans fantasy during the Vietnam times, as you take place of a man named Lincoln Clay, who has returned from the war, and things turn nasty rather quickly. However, that's up to you to find out what happens.

The setting in this game is rather different than the other titles, this game does not much involved you much in the Mafia, however, you do deal with them still, just not like how it was like in the past.

Graphics are alright, but they do look like they aren't rendered correctly, and just look awful. I'm not picky with graphics, I mandatory Gameplay and Storylines more, especially for this type of game. However, sometimes the game does look damn beautiful, especially at night time.

review: It would`ve been bad even as a stand-alone game, but it`s atrocious as a Mafia game. Full of bugs, glitches and just plain old boring gameplay. But if you`re up for swelf-torture session... be my guest!

review:
Criminally underrated game. There are lot of open world crime games on the market, none with a story as engaging and as well performed as this is. Genuinely surprised. 

Now, is the general game loop repetitive? yes - but more importantly is it fun? absolutely 100%. 
The combat and general game play is just so satisfying. Every hit, shot, stab, punch feels weighted and fluent. 

This title sadly launched with so many bugs which has given it a bad reputation, however these issues for the most part have been patched out now, I've run into zero performance issues.

I had my doubts about this game. The amount of cut scenes in the beginning made me think, "oh, great. A story driven game that doesn't focus on gameplay.." I looked up online and saw that it was the best part of the game! Boy, was I wrong. The story was great! After a while, I actually enjoyed watching them, almost like playing a new game in my younger years when games felt more engaging. I gave this game a chance and here I am, excited to play it again, but not for a while. I saved a ton of side quests for later because I found out that there was no new game plus, or anything to do after you beat the game 100%. That's one of the things I was disappointed with. There are bugs in this game as well but that's normal for a lot of games so I won't criticize it that much. Some of the guns are fun to fire, like the m60 or that m1 garand looking one. Best part of the game for me was how the enemies would die when they got shot. They'd then lie on the ground, either dying slowly or quickly or a simple bullet to the head. Just a bit of realism I enjoyed. The mission are DEFINITELY repetitive but for me it was no problem. I watch YouTube videos and stuff while playing so no big deal. Burke reminds me of that one guy in Bohemian Rhapsody, Cassandra needs to relax and have a beer, and Vito is the MAN! He's the only one who didn't complain about me not giving him work. The only thing I HATED about this game was not that much replay value. Great game though, I don't see why all the hate. 4/5

review: Only when I started playing this game, I didn't understand many things, but I fell in love with this game! Yes, this game has a few drawbacks, namely a strange system of hiding places and cars, but the pros are very much outweighed and showed what a game really cool. I liked the plot and the atmosphere of the game. Shown are the same times, robberies, robberies and more. I recommend everyone to buy this game. I didn't get through to the end, but I recommend it to everyone!

review: I installed this game for a 3rd time because i just have to finish it. But it is so boring. It has the same mission over and over again in a different parts of town. At first it was ok but after playing it for 3 days it became pure agony. I will finish the game because I'm a mafia fan. There is no fast travel. Another point to a perfect masochistic experience. And i hate when my car gets wrecked because i hit a small bush. Not to mention the bugs where you have to reload the checkpoint. Lazy made game.

review: My review remains unchanged from Mafia III (Standard) and Mafia III (Definitive). The gameplay itself is fun and the movements are fluid so long as you have a controller that can be adapted to your PC, otherwise the controls are naturally clunky. Story design is probably the saving grace to this games repetitiveness in accomplishing "Side-Missions" to further your individual rackets. Collectible Hunting is as time consuming as always, but if there isn't an achievement for collecting the Fuses for Wire Tapping, why have 3000 of them? All in all i'd give the game a 6/10, would recommend if you have patience.

review: Excellent game. Great driving and weapons. Great story. Great sound track. Good voice acting. I'm having a blast. I have had my car stuck in a Street light or two but I'm not supposed to be driving into lamp posts at 100mph. Simple solution - call in another car! A bit too much swearing for me though. After a while it becomes the only humor element in the game. I find myself laughing at some of the the crazy things they say.

review: I understand that this is not the best game in the mafia trilogy, but honestly don't let the comment section dictate your final choice on weather or not to buy a game. I didn't like it as much as other games in the mafia franchise, but regardless, this is a really fun game. The story line is gripping, the characters are well written, and the world is alive and full of freedom. Try out the demo. If you don't like it, don't buy the game.

review: At first I had some minor issues getting the game going. Some cut screens had audio but no display, just blank black screens.  The game is enjoyable. The cut screens are long but you can skip them if you wish.   The gun fights can be challenging at first before you get a hang of it. Overall the game differs from other open world type games I played so I have been enjoying it. Get the game with the other mafia games when the whole pack is onsale for less then 20 dollars.

review:
So I got this as part of the humble bundle ages ago and recently I've actually had the time to start playing it. I don't generally review things but hey lets go. I'm having a love hate relationship with this game.

I love it because I love the almost documentary like style of cut-scenes, I love this time period as my dad practically raised me on this era of music and the like And the story feels good, I like Lincoln as a character, I like the supporting cast like Donovan he's great, the exact kind of guy I'd want if I was gonna take over a city. The city looks pretty nice graphics are good all that jazz Grade A. That's not my problem.

The reason why I have problems with this game, its the controls. Lincoln's character controls are manageable but he feels clunky at times, which I can live with cos he's a big muscled army beefcake that's shredded. So finding him a bit awkward in a small space, or knocking something over or him feeling like you're driving a tank fair enough. Driving, Oh my gods the driving. I play keyboard and I haven't tried it with a controller because I'm awful with them but it feels like you're driving a rock, heavy vehicles and bad handling on every car, I've tested most of them by stealing different ones to find a good one then being chased by police so I got a good handling workout, breaking just makes  you skid all over the place and the slow-mo only helps so much. Its really a shame because I'd love to cruise around looking at the city in a beautiful recreation of classic cars.

So here's my final take. You want a really nice looking period piece game of the Vietnam era with all the music and themes to go with it some of the attention to detail is really nice, great, go for it. If you want a game where you can drive easily, and cruise or speed around escaping from cops in high speed pursuits maybe stick to some other games (my game has ended up being stealth based because of this, Ninja Lincoln ftw!)

review:
Don't let my hours fool you: I have about 30 hours on the Xbox One version which I bought for full price on day 1. Why then, do I own the PC version?

Is it because the game was good? No.
I own it because I played it during a very dark time in my life. It sort of distracted me from my troubles. In a way, this game is nostalgic for only those reasons.

Is the game as bad as everyone says it is? Honestly? Yes. It's one of the most boring, mind-numbingly repetitive games on the market. If you're old enough to remember the old Prototype games, this is pretty much the mob version of that. The characters are all dull (though, the voice acting is awesome). 

I'd give anyone who has had the patience to beat this game and get all the achievements a medal. This is coming from someone who enjoys period pieces. I LOVE historical games and even then, that wasn't enough for me to like this game.

If you want a better alternative, play Yakuza 0. At first glance it looks like a weaboo game for anime-lovers but after about 30 minutes, it calms down into a mature crime story. This is coming from one of the few people who absolutely hates anime.

The game gets a 5/10 - Average. I'd advise playing this title if you are truly bored and have nothing to do. I mean, if you have absolutely no life or if you're transitioning between jobs and have exhausted all other entertainment options, play this game. That's the only people I can recommend this game to.

review: I've played this game for over a 100 hours since it's release. While extremely repetitive, it's story and gameplay were engaging, satisfying, and relaxing. However, the release of the Definitive Edition has essentially made this game, one of my all-time favorites since childhood, unplayable. Whereas Mafia 3 ran perfectly on my current laptop (which far exceeds the recommended requirements for the game) before the Definitive Edition was released,  I am now unable to play this game at all. I experience frequent and game-breaking fame drops, lag, and graphical bugs when playing. These issues are so bad a prevalent that I was unable to play past the first 5 minutes. To bypass this issue, I had to purchase Mafia 3 on GOG which does not sell the Definitive Edition. It works perfectly on GOG as of the updating of this review.

review:
Catch it on sale or not at all.

I thought I'd feel right at home, given all the hours I put into The Godfather II on PS3. But even someone like me, who is used to redundancy and repetition in the name of mobster storytelling, is tired by Mafia III. Solid story and unique setting aside, this game has very little going for it. The unique mechanics of police response and calling in help are just not enough to make this series a proper alternative to Grand Theft Auto. 

The game controls fine. Driving works. It's no Forza, but zipping around in classic muscle cars is fun. Songs on the radio are pretty solid as well, they did their research. I feel fine 99% of the time going through this on keyboard and mouse. Gunplay feels great too. I feel much more confident flanking enemies and taking the charge here than I did back in Mafia II. Everything feels like it has weight.

But it's not enough. The game has improved since its launch, but still. It took a while to stop launching into a black screen the first few times I ran it. Ragdolls and corpses will clip through things consistently. Animations beyond Lincoln Clay himself are lacking. View distance is a joke. You'll see cars spawn in if you're driving at any decent speed. Audio will play in the pause menu, whether it's from the radio or an NPC speaking. Characters' clothes will fly around in cutscenes even if they're just sitting. Hell, only half of the cutscenes seem to use whatever custom outfit you're wearing... even though a lot of them don't seem pre-rendered? I can't imagine how it runs on other PCs.

And worse than all the jank is the gameplay loop. It wasn't enough to warrant the $60 at launch, and it's barely enough to warrant the $30 now. Even with the difficulty jacked, running all these errands to take territory is not that satisfying. At least The Godfather II kept things interesting with you defending your rackets, resulting in all-around turf wars. All you do here is balance the perks from your underbosses after giving them rackets. Tight as the mechanics might feel, they can't carry this whole campaign. The story isn't being done justice. A Netflix mini-series would've made more of an impact than this middling open-world sandbox.

Mafia III is less along the lines of Grand Theft Auto and Watch Dogs, and much more akin to Sleeping Dogs and Saints Row. That is to say, lacking. Again, catch a sale.

review: If you can see past or don't mind repetitive game play, the story is great. Acting is really good and characters are likable. It does have some grind to it and it does not feel like an original Mafia game at all, which is why I think some people didn't like it which is completely fine. Strip that name away however and you have a game that is pretty fun with a great story. DLC is meh, I would say 2/3 are okay. Growing weed and hybridizing it to make more money is extremely simple yet satisfying in my opinion. Overall I give it a 6.5/10.

review:
Reading through some of the other reviews for this title, I suppose your mileage may vary in terms of what the Definitive Edition update did. On my end, it seems to have slightly bumped the performance without having to do any workaround, whereas before this update, I had to do some tweaking on my end to get the game running just a bit worse than it does with this update. That said, on to the game itself.

I enjoy Mafia III's world, characters, gunplay, exploration, and one of my favorite aspects is how well I feel Clay feels to control. That said, and as many other reviews have stated, there isn't enough of that to help keep the player enagaged. Mafia III could have benefited from dynamic events happening around the city as you move from one mission to the next - that's really where the game dwindles. When moving around the city to start the next mission, be it side-story or main, there doesn't feel like there is much to do, aside from searching for a collectible here or there that may pop-up. The game, as a whole, also could have been optimized much better, too, but, that this point, it pretty much is what it is.

I think Mafia III is a fun time with an interesting batch of characters and story set within a detailed yet somewhat empty feeling world. If you like open world games, chances are you will enjoy this too.
Good story and cinematics.

review:
I like this game. I like the protagonist. I like the story and I like the 1960's aesthetics. What I don't like is how the 'Definitive Edition' made this game utterly unplayable. Constant crashes. Missing textures. My car can randomly get stuck in a bush. It amazes me how 2K looked at Mafia III and thought "hey, let's find a way to screw this game up". The game ran fine for me before they decided to downgrade it. Kudos, 2K. Kudos.

Edit (11/08/20) : So after completing the game and choosing a 'safer' ending for Lincoln, I would have to rate this game as between positive and negative. 
Would I recommend it? 
> Yes, if you like a heavy story, a fleshed out protagonist and want to beat up members of the KKK and racist bigots.
> No, due to the fact that it is riddled with bugs, there are so many repetitive missions, bushes are indestructible, missions bug out and there are so many repetitive missions (see what I did there).

Overall rating - 7/10 (without bugs)

review: You know.. I mostly write reviews only for games ive really enjoyed and games that really grew to my hearth and could call them best games ever made. This game is neither of those but it is still something special. Definitely not perfect. The missions get pretty repetitive and by "pretty" i mean really quickly. Havent encountered any bugs, like any at all which was actually surprising although.. they could have gotten more time with the optimization and sometimes the game starts in window even tho you had fullscreen on and when it crashes which does quite a bit when loading in from main menu or launching the game, it gets quite annoying but i can assure you, no to minimal crashes in game. At least to my experience. But the shooting, driving model(which you can choose between 2, normal and simulation. I played the whole game in the simulation mode so cant say how different it is tho.) and THE STORY just makes it all worth it. Man.. The story. Its really really and i mean really well done. The characters feel alive and ive noticed a few times even the small, almost unimportant characters like basic enemies, the rackets bosses etc. have a character even tho its not needed and wouldnt most likely hurt the game if they didnt have any character, but they did that and to me, that feels like they really wanted to make a worthy successor to the first 2 games. Is it tho? well.. definitely could have been better but damn the story is good!

review:
I was hyped for this game from the beginning. The story looked so good, the trailer showing the return of Vito. What could go wrong? A lot did.

Just about every mission is the same exact thing over and over again. Clear this area out, kill or spare a guy, damage the opposing gang/mob's intake. That doesn't even mention the countless bugs and crashing that occurs.

I started playing the game again recently with the release of Definitive Edition. Played it for a few hours and then the next time I launched it, the launcher crashes immediately. I've verified the files, tried different suggestions online and nothing. The only thing left to do is reinstall the entire game, but am I going to waste my time waiting for this game, of all games, to redownload? Absolutely not. I'll find a much better use of 50gb for this garbage.

Top Draw... The whole series is brilliant the first time round. Even better the second! I have to say Driving "In my opinion" is FAR BETTER NOW!! Great game, a few Bug's..Yes still!! but really playable and enjoyable.  Highly Recommend.

review:
Mafia 3 is buggy, looks relatively shoddy for how demanding it is to run and depending on area/mission unstable. This even after the game being originally released in 2016. If you just play the game without checking out any tips on how to take over rackets it's going to start to feel like a repetitive slog sooner rather than later and that hurts the narrative impact of the game relative to Mafia 2 which is a purely a story driven experience. There's plenty of good reasons behind the games rather low steam percentage score, of that there's no doubt.

But even with all those obstacles to overcome to properly get into the game it's still a Mafia game and the gameplay and driving is fundamentally solid and fun with the caveat that the enemy AI can be exploited once you get used to its quirks, then again that's true for a lot of other action shooter games. There's just too much stuff to do that can derail the Mafia game experience if you where expecting something similar to first two games, unfortunately, but once you accept the game for what it is you can still get a lot out of it especially if you take to all the different characters the game introduces to you which range from insane to mostly depressed but at least you got a level headed wiseguy like yourself in Vito (player character from the 2nd game) as one of your underbosses so that helps steady the rest of the cast. A lot of the side stuff can be fun but can be easily ignored if you just want to move to main story along.

One thing to note is the season pass dlc is actually quite good and enjoyable and gives you good story driven missions that give certain key main game NPCs further character development while providing you with different gameplay challenges, settings and mechanics relative to the main game. They also provide you with weapons, vehicles and equipment that can speed up the repetitive task of racket acquisition that is the meat of the campaign so my suggestion is to do them asap as soon as they become available.

Mafia 3 isn't for everyone but if you are a fan of the earlier games especially the 2nd one and open world GTA-likes in general it's worth a try if you can get it during a sale. It can be pretty good at its best and rather frustrating if a bug impedes your progress but I will make note that these bugs where at their worst during optional side content and not with the main content of the campaign and the dlc (though each dlc also has its own side content after the main story part concludes).

There you have it. Another flawed game that with the right slant can be pretty damn good. Hopefully this helped a bit in you deciding if its the right fit for you or not.

review:
I love the Mafia franchise and I enjoyed mafia 2 and Mafia 1 so I was hoping that Mafia 3 would be just as good and would build off its predecessors.

The missions are very monotonous and boring and the same. You kill the enforcers of a racket and cause damage to the business and eventually you cause  the boss of that racket to come out and this same thing over and over. Its gets boring fast so it took me at least year to complete the game thats is how bad Mafia 3 is.

review:
[h1] [b] Bugs I have encountered: [/b] [/h1]

1. Screen freezes, audio still plays
2. Floating environment props
3. Enemy seeing me from across the map
4. Cars getting stuck in the ground
5. During some races the car won't move at all
6. When opening the game I get frozen screen and need to restart
7. Map becomes extra large and the gps street becomes too big
8. when doing the circle thingy when opening locked doors, it does not zoom in
9. sometimes when calling for a car it doesn't come
10. when speaking to a character, the option to press E doesn't show
11. Enemies getting stuck into boxes
12. some side missions still pop up even after completed, and when going to the mission site there is no truck to steal

( NEW bugs discovered 02/08/2020)

13. sometimes when killing an enemy, it can leave them standing frozen
14. driving through a fence with a sign, may leave the sign floating in the air
14. sometimes the game freezes for 5 seconds and then resumes
15. sometimes the button Q does not appear for stealthy take-downs (but still performs them if pressed continuously)
16. some achievements do not unlock, even after met the requirement
17. for communist posters I have collected 100% of them, but I still found some after reaching 100%
18. when doing car races sometimes the car won't move, so you have to abandon mission, exit vehicle, enter vehicle, and start the mission again
19. falling with the car in the water at high speed may teleport you under the map where you endlessly fall


[h1] [b] Things I did NOT like: [/b] [/h1]

- sometimes, npc jump in front of your car when driving fast
- gameplay very repetitive
- cops pop your tire too fast
- sometimes travelling distances are wayyyy too long and feels tedious
- sometimes cars don't move when using the car horn
- boats are a bit hard to control
- use of weapons and fighting techniques are always the same
- killing bosses doesn't feel special or rewarding
- graphics could be better, character hair is oof, and facial expressions not that great compared to rivals
- sometimes the lighting can be overexposed and the whole screen is white
- NOT all cars are customizable (the ones you find on the street) and there is no way to save a car
- when doing a side mission and driving a truck, the truck sometimes becomes your main vehicle and lose the old one 
- I wished there was more exploring in the game, since the world is so big and detailed, you don't explore it much, but your travel a lot
- sometimes you have multiple objectives at once and the missions and map always leads you to the one that is the most far way, and therefore you travel and waste time
- no manual save button
-BUSHES ARE OBSTACLES, you can crash your car in them...just no

(added 02/08/2020)

- nothing left to do after game is finished
- ending not as exciting
- the island DLC was cool, but once you finish the mission, you can't go there anymore

[h1] [b] Things I did like: [/b] [/h1]

- DLCs added a refreshment (with the investigation mechanic, weed farm and car chases)
- if you buy it with the trilogy, the game is not worth much which is good money value
- the worlds are beautiful, historically accurate
- the cars are amazing and they are hard to handle, which adds a fun challenge to the game
- Races are cool, although to get 1st + you need to work on story to unlock upgrades and new cars
- Combat system is smooth and well done, nice variation of guns but I wished enemies had more variation in the guns
- Story is rich and interesting it keeps me going
-Character development is good altho relationships with other characters are not as developed ( romantic relationship with Roxy feels rushed)
- other ways to make money (weed farm) 
- different districts represent different cities of the US, therefore the environment feels extremely diverse and big
- other additions are very nice, such as outfits, car customizations
- characters are racists and n word is used a lot, brave for a game company to do, I like it
- ability to call for a car and weapon store wherever you want is awesome, so you don't have to travel to a point on the map for that
- the game is around 150 hours (including completing EVERYTHING like achievements and collectables)
- there are PlayBoy magazines, say hi to boobies 

[h1] [b] BIGGEST DOWNFALL [/b] [/h1]

- very repetitive, every mission feels the same, and the game feels more like a hitman game than a mafia game. Combat system is too simple and no new features added (unless you buy the DLCs which adds the slow-mo)


[h1] [b] BIGGEST PERK [/b] [/h1]

- the environments are beautiful and historically accurate, story is rich and in all categories the game does either fine or good, but it's never amazing


[h1] [b] CONCLUSION [/b] [/h1]

It may seem like a lot of negativity from me. For a mafia fan, this game is most likely a disappointment. If you never played a Mafia game (like me) I would give this game a go. (and since the price is cheap, you get a lot of value for your money).

[h1] [b] SCOREEEE [/b] [/h1]

6.7/10

review:
literally trash. you waste ur time doing damge to ur enemies, driving so stupid they say it's realstic but it's so stupid especially when the police are chasing you.
stupid AI and really stupid enemies very easy to beat, shooting mechanics 2/10
molotov and grenedes throw 0.1/10 very bad animation

at the beginning it was a really good start for the story but the gameplay ruined the story even the game feels so unfinished and I was hoping to have Vito again as the main character not having this super human Mr.clay. 
beautiful city but too bad there isn't much to do or explore 
I spent around 45 hours in this game I have to say that this game is a big disappointed for me after playing Mafia II in 2011 I was expecting much more from Mafia III, but I have to say even with many stupid things in the game I actually enjoyed it for some reason. Do I recommend this game Hell no but I liked how stupid this game is and I renamed it in my mind to " Grand Buggy Auto " so it isn't mafia game for me anymore then I start doing the stupid missions in many stupid ways and I had some laughs :)

6/10 (not bad game)

review:
I wanted the game for a while. Read the reviews and decided to try out the demo first.
Lot of people complaining bout crashes and bugs so thought it was a fine way to check it out.
The Demo worked excelent for me. No faults at all.

So I buy the game with the promise that progress made can be taken to the bought game.
I start from the start and have to replay the about 45 mins of the demo.
Thats all good by me though, is a nice little playtrough. But then within minutes the game sounds starts acting up, cutscenes and talk between actors in car stop working right. 
To say it short. The demo works great. The second I started the real game, the negative things from the reviews started to show themselfs. Not saying do not buy but saying be prepared.. Its buggy. I will play it as I am stubborn bugger but cant recommend a product that do not live up to its demo

review:
Its a fun game. Basically looks and feels like a low budget version of GTAV. The Gameplay or rather the story quests are beside the wellmade cutscenes veeery repetitive which is a bit of a downer for my part.
The driving is a bit wobbly and feels sometimes as if you were driving on ice but yet the atmosphere, characters and the general look and feel is very nice and its enjoyable.

review: This game is like the lovechild of the best game play components from the Godfather II video game and Scarface: The World is yours videogame. In the event that you are looking to purchase a GTA clone videogame - THIS IS NOT IT. This game is in a different league on it's own and builds more on the management side of organized crime, much like in the game Godfather II. There are A LOT of fetch/grab/go-here missions in this video game so if repetition is something that bothers you then don't buy this game. The story is pretty good but personally, I wish that they would have incorporated more backstory about Joe Barbaro but that is me being a whiney mafia fan. The ending to this game irritated me very much so -very anti-climactic. The sense of accomplishment I achieved from taking over each of the rackets in the game is a great feeling. OVERALL this game is at a 7/10 for me. Play it for yourself to figure out if you're a fan of the Mafia series.

review:
Played few years ago, but still remember it as a great game. And having that said, from me is it's a pretty seldom compliment note since actually I'm not really a big fan of ego- or third-party role play shooters. However evaluating this game as a positive surprise to me. Chapeaux to designers and developers from Hangar 13.

Simplified evaluation below  (1 worst - 10 best)
+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
- I loved the story, it was just excellent, well written considered for the time when the game was released - it was never 
  boring you're the good guy destroying the bad scum even though facing moral dilemas. I liked the realistic fact that even 
  the good guys included agents and the preacher do have got often also pretty biting questions and bad conscience  - 9
- the setup design of the environment (city and surroundings) just awesome  - 9
- graphics well done - loved the sharp reflections on road while driving through the rain towards a sunset - awesome, 
  considered the time when game released  it was a splendid graphics achievement  - 10
- UX, still intuitive handling even though here and there there was a slight delay in reaction in combat - 7 
- nice nearly authentic cars to drive with a solid sound  -  8 
- Bugs pretty seldom , were  ther  any  at all? Don't remember - 9 
- Sound - pretty good - 8 
- music not evaluated since for me personally plays the music in games secondary role only - instead I apprecite rather 
  game content  -  * 

This game was like,initially I just haven't expected absolutely nothing, back then. However I was excited with the time I dived in New Bordeaux.  Althoug there was probably just a bit too much of political correctness sh**  embedded in the dialogs,  but when considering those events nowadays , then maybe it was alright to rise awareness back then too indeed.
-
Summary: I would definitelly recommend to any of my buddies (hey this game is so entertaining and story line credible, environment great fun - New orleans replica  New Bordeaux- it is all so good it can be w/o concerns recommended also to sceptics or even to strictly strategy only gamers)
-
I'm waiting impatiently for some next Mafia IV chapter with nasty take downs.

review:
This game is a shame. It never got improved, started as a joke and now the so-called "definitive edition" is even worse. Its the most repetitive game I've ever seen i my life, they should be ashamed to put it in the Mafia franchise which was and still is a success because of Mafia I and II only. This game should be deleted forever as an apology to all the Mafia fans. Performance that always su**ed now is even worse, graphics "barely" improved, to say the least, and the overall gaming experience is dreadful.

Graphics: 4/10
Gameplay: 4/10
Lack of respect: 10/10
Shame: 100/10

review:
I like the idea of this game in the first 30mins you get a feeling for how Clay really is as a person from the character dynamics to just random conversations. this game is very broken for a pc port. if you want to play this and have the means to play it on console.  i have to run with everything basically its lowest and i still get 30fps with it dropping constantly from 30 all the way to 1. i have a gtx 1050ti, i5 8th, 16gb ram. the only reason i don't like this game is because of the constant stuttering and frame drop. just for comparison on how broken the game is i can play escape from tarkov on low and get 90fps+ and not have a issue. It makes me want to buy a ps4 and play it again on that. So no i would not recommend this game unless you have a beefy PC

"EDIT"
So after playing a addition 7hrs with a higher tier pc. ryzen 7 5800xt, 3050 8gb, 32gb ram, and a m.2. This game has fixed alot of issues. it was also the "original" edition of the game. I have played enough to where i can say if you want to pick it up on sale do it. The gameplay loop is very 2017 but it fits the criteria and the soundtrack is amazing. If you find it on sale pick it up its worth it or get into the combo for triple the value at a better price.

review: This is an interesting game, because you will be kind of slapped in the faced when you start the game for the first time. You are expecting sequel to Mafia 2 game and that just is not happening, and you are thrown inside a story that is hard to grab early into the game. But if you hold on to it and continue playing it will get easier, I would not want to use the term getting used to the game, but kind of is like that. Game will get better the more you play it, you will feel the story of game more and more until you find yourself in a middle of the story line. If you get past this first feelings of underwhelming story beginning and weird form of a gameplay when you take parts of the city and letting your minions control them and not having the expected very story driven gameplay without free roaming, exploring and side quests, game will start to feel good, like really good. Gameplay, soundtrack and graphics are amazing. If you launch this game with right expectation ‚Äì good game from mafia era and less as direct sequel to mafia 2 ‚Äì you will have great experience. This might not be best, nor great mafia game, but it is awesome mafia themed game.

review: The biggest issue this game has is all the bugs and glitches, that's probably the single worst thing you will notice. Performance isn't all that great either. However the game itself is really fun, driving and shooting is amazing, you can even shoot while sprinting. At launch it was pretty grindy but now that they added the DLCs into the game for free, they break up the middle section of the game nicely and overall it flows pretty well. I recommend picking it up when it's on a sale.

review: Mafia 3 is an odd game. When it came out, it felt like it had gone against everything that Mafia 2 had created. Vito still remains, but at the time of release the game felt like a hollow redebut of a series loved by many. It's 2020, and in with a handful of time, I decided to give Mafia 3 another shot now that the DLC was given out for free with the "Definitive Upgrade" the games have received. Mafia 3 is not a perfect game; there are many times where textures or glitches appear, yet this didn't ever truly ruin the experience other than a restart once. The story is what really dragged me in, as a revenge plot story which ends in a bitter sweet way leaves the player with the choice of how Lincoln Clay will truly live after his job is done. Overall, the game was decent. Not perfect, but also not something worth skipping over entirely if you're interested. Pick it up on sale, as that's the best way to get a bang for your buck.

The game is now: Your a nigger killing white crackers, folk and police officers without mercy BULLSHIT.

I want my money back! I'm not paying for this racist shit.

review:
Too repetitive gameplay, maybe next time spent less money getting known bands songs to the game and use it to give a little bit more unique missions. There were only three types of missions, kill mob and loot, interrogate a guy surrounded by a mob or kill a special guy surrounded by a mob. After that you get the bigger mission where you claim territory. What is required from you? Well kill or spare the big guy surrounded by a mob. This goes on about 85% of the game. No thank you. I don't know how I managed to spend 42 hrs in this game. Maybe I thought the missions would change but only the size of the mob you need to slaughter was getting bigger so...  Some of the dlcs have a bit more unique gameplay but what the ef? you need to buy dlc to get a bit unique gameplay f*ck that.. 2.5/5.

Also it is still a bit buggy. 1.Game won't start just a black screen, go to desktop and open from background again repeat until it works or just restart game. 2. Sounds get messed when going to desktop from game (sometimes). 3. Cars explode randomly in game? 4. Drive to river fast and you might find yourself below the ground level. (only thing to do is restart checkpoint.)
5. Mobs get a sixth sense where you are if you trigger proximity mines twice without getting spotted.

I enjoyed the game, the story was good. I know there is so many mission is repetitive, but if you get over that the main story is amazing. 
My only problem is the NPC lol those are worse thn 90s games.

review: This game is shockingly unpolished. There‚Äôs so much evidence of money in this game‚Äôs development and the writing, acting, licensed music, and assets are all fantastic. But the gameplay itself has the game-feel of a low budget school project, it‚Äôs just baffling how bad it feels. Part of this is the PC port- with a controller cars feel much better and general walking around is passable but gunplay is impossible with a controller as the auto aim isn‚Äôt great. Without a controller sure you can aim but the haptics of firing feel genuinely awful, providing almost no feedback or recoil. The game really feels like a cheap Indy title lifted off the Xbox Live Arcade- but one that cost millions to make.

review:
Mafia 3 is highly anticipated sequel to great and beloved Mafia 2 and with a promise of an open world, people were hoping to get less linear story telling as well as freedom to build our drug empire at our own terms. Well, we did not exactly get that. Mafia 3 is plagued by so many issues that I find it quite understandable if some people are appalled by them and do not finish the game. And I hold Hangar 13 responsible for that for if not for the mission design and structure issues, the game could have easily been the best in the series for it has several " the best's" in the Mafia franchise - best cutscenes and mo-cap, best shooting, best driving and ABSOLUTE best soundtrack. If only the devs decided to make it linear as the two previous games, it would have worked out so much better as the clearly do not know how to make appealing open-world game design. And that bothers me because Mafia 3 tells an incredible story about racism in the US in the 60s and to see it from Lincoln's perspective is an experience that few games have managed to achieve. All that is amplified by the best mo-cap seen to date as well as greatly executed voice acting. So overall, even though the game has myriad of problems, I can still recommend you playing it even for just wanting to experience the great story a characters the game has to offer. You just need to get through those annoying and repetitive racket missions.

Pros:
+ Game managed to capture the atmosphere of 60s USA perfectly with all its highs and lows
+ Soundtrack, soundtrack, SOUNDTRACK - only the best selection of pop/rock/jazz music of what was probably the era
+ Shooting and combat in general felt satisfying until the very end
+ Driving (as long as you have it on simulation mode)
+ Story and cutscenes reinforced by spot on voice acting 
+ Characters that can easily compete with best movies ones - Father James, Donovan the Underbosses - all played very naturally with each one of them being interesting
+ Upgrading feels rewarding enough
+ New Bordeaux with all its districts from rich folks parts to the bayou is really well crafted 
+ Attention to detail - the small things like radio crackling when in tunnel and small animations

Cons:
- Overall graphics - while animations look incredibly good, overall graphical design is lacking - even on ultra settings the game just doesnt look that good - you can either select highest antialiasing which, due to being consolist FXAA makes everything blurry or you can set it on low and not have the blur and bokeh effect but suddenly everything has jagged lines. You can not win here
- Racket missions - the main point why people dislike Mafia 3 and yes, it is very much a valid one. These mandatory side missions are completely and utterly same in all 9 Rackets and there are 2 people in each racket you need to complete these missions for which makes you doing same exact thing that got old after first racket total of 18 TIMES. Side mission design anybody?
- Rest of the side missions is not better at all - you can either drive a truck/boat to rackets to increase their income (this too is completely the same every time) or do an assigment for underbosses to earn their favor and these s*ck too - you only want to do the for Vito to learn about his past and Joe but its not worth it
- Certain cutscenes are premade and locked at 60/30 fps while others support unlocked framerate - WHYYYYY!?
- Clothing - no shopping for clothes, going to barber to change hair/beard cut, you are stuck with limited selection of outfits ( and that is still better than when the game launched as there was no customization to speak of)

review: Definite edition? Nope. They have ruined the game with the recent new updates. I was playing fine before hand, now it is horrible. Draw distance is now arms length, in the day i can see shadows and building textures pop in front of my eyes as i near them, at night its a lot worse, as it seems lights turn on as you near them. Lights literally turn on after you've already seen them on street lamps and buildings, its really annoying and ruins immersion and experience. It's like they fixed nothing and added way more bugs, not really acceptable considering the size of the updates. The game was literally fine until I decided to finally update today, it's literally ruined the game. There's also loads of screen flashing, cut scenes seem to be way less smooth at 60fps now, why? I'm so disappointed. There should be an option to revert back to the previous edition. honestly wish I never updated now. They have made this game look like crap

review:
I would recommend this, but with a few caveats. The worldbuilding and story is great. The music fantastic. Where the game fails a bit is focus. I feel it would have been a much better game if they handn't gone deep into the Open World tropes,  such as collectables that look nice but don't do anything, and repetitive but necessary side missions to unlock bigger side missions so you can get another story mission before repeating the progress again and again. I am currently on my second attempt to finish this game and I feel I will fail once again, simply because there is so much busy work to get to the good parts that I get bored after a while.

Get on a discount. Enjoy the city and atmosphere. And then abandon Lincoln's mission for vengeance after the fifteenth time you punch out a mid rank wiseguy to recruit him for some vague promise of a bonus to your earnings later on, realising you're gonna be doing this a few times more.

review:
I loved Mafia II, and so, when I saw Mafia III on sale, despite all of the criticism, and I decided to give it a try, I really tried to like the game but, unfortunately, I just couldn't, the story seemed kind of empty from the time I played, really really bad optimization, lots of bugs, the driving is not good...
Overall, Mafia III is really underwhelming, taking into consideration how good Mafia II was.

review:
This game had so much potential, but it fails in my opinion. In the end I am giving it a thumbs down because its repetitive and has some weird design choices that doesn't suit the Mafia series well.

This review comes from a Mafia fan who didn't want to touch this entry from this series, but I've only gave it a chance because I've got it for basically 5‚Ç¨ in that Mafia DE bundle.
The mechanics of this game feel weird (shooting, driving) at first, but you can get used to it. I have no idea how they have gotten worse from Mafia 2, even tho the game runs on the same engine. The driving feels unrealistic and the gunplay is unpolished.

The story of this game is‚Ä¶ good i guess? Before I‚Äôve finished the game I was hating on the story but the grand finale kinda got me. Still the story isn‚Äôt as astounding as it was in the first or second Mafia game but the story was decent overall. I have only two complains about it, first there is a huge dead space between the start and the end in the story and second, the end is too long. In my opinion the credits should have appeared as soon as you kill the main villain of this game. Instead after beautiful ending, you still have to drive and do some decisions before the credits appear.

The mission design on the other hand‚Ä¶ well, it‚Äôs a mess. And a main reason this game got a dislike from me. The introduction to this game is O.K., then there is a huge repetitive cycle of: ‚ÄúGo to these two guys, they will tell you about the two rackets here, then deal X amount of damage to these rackets, then kill the leaders of these rackets, after that kill the main guy behind the two guys you‚Äôve just killed, then (the only interesting part of the game) is killing the leader of the district you‚Äôre taking over. It would be fine if you would have to repeat this cycle a few times, but you gotta do this 9 times throughout the game, that means doing X amount of damage to rackets (which is the most painful part) 18 times overall. Most of the time the missions are just mindless shooting and most of the stuff feels like a daily questing in MMORPG‚Äôs. But there are some exceptions. As I said, killing the main boss of the district and then the final boss itself are part of unique missions and it almost feels like you‚Äôre actually playing a Mafia game.

Next the graphics of this game: I don‚Äôt know what they did, but the game looks awful. It‚Äôs blurry and really dark. I‚Äôve played on the maximum settings and it didn‚Äôt help. 

Also, this game is so utterly breaking the Mafia formula‚Ä¶ For example, cops in any other Mafia game are pain in the ass and they want to punish you for every crime you do (speeding, stealing a car). But in this game, they are an absolute joke, they never go for you, they can‚Äôt also issue you a ticket, they can only shoot at you, feels a lot like GTA cops. Next you have to assign districts etc. to your ‚Äúpartners‚Äù, also feels again like a GTA game. Also you never go on a mission with your partners. They also gave Lincoln wallhack and slow motions abilities for some god knows what reason, the game would be fine without them.

Next, the city is so dead. Don‚Äôt get me wrong, every Mafia game had that, but in I and II you had no incentive to go into the town, it was just used to travel from point A to point B. In mafia II you had to visit a garage or a clothes shop to get rid of the wanted level at least, but both Mafia I and II weren‚Äôt open world games. And I actually like that. But this game presents itself like an open world game. But there are no shops or anything you would ever need. You have your phone so you can do a few phone calls to get your car guns, whatever you like.
Bug wise, I‚Äôve only encountered few where I couldn‚Äôt pick up an object to complete a mission or NPC got stuck somewhere and I had to reload the checkpoint. But the game was functional (at least for me).

Closing words: This game wasn‚Äôt as far as I thought away from being a good game. But it‚Äôs still by no means good. If you‚Äôre a diehard Mafia fan like me, then go for it, play this game with the lowest expectations you can, and you will be pleasantly surprised. If you never played a Mafia game before, finish I and II first, its much more worth it. I‚Äôd love to play this game again to do different decisions with my districts, but I‚Äôm not going to do X amount of damage 18 times ever again.

review:
I'll start off by saying that this game is not as good as Mafia II but it's also not as bad as most say. Personally, I believe that the story itself was very gripping and made a lot of sense, I felt for the characters and enjoyed my time. Gameplay-wise this is different from Mafia II, it's much more "open" - you can more or less choose in what order you do things. It gets very repetitive, you take over the city district after district but I still enjoyed it, had to take a few breaks, though. 

The first time I picked this game up it was very buggy and I stopped playing after an hour, I can definitely say that the definitive edition fixed a lot of the issues I was having. Mafia III is not a must-have by any means but I would recommend getting it on a decent sale, otherwise you can safely pass.

review:
You need to be a masochist or a die-hard Mafia fan to enjoy this game. It's just boring. 9 districts where you need to do enough damage to certain rackets in order to bring out an "underboss", so you can kill the district boss in some bloody "shootem-up" DOOM style showdown. Over, and over, and over again, I found myself entering a large building stuffed to the brim with enemies that all call you the n-word, shoot at you, then down after being shot 1-2 times. I beat this game twice, I think, and I regret it. 

Don't buy unless it's on sale for 10-20 dollars. It's not worth anything more than that.

review: Game has alot of ups and downs for example cons are the graphical settings in certain areas and just flaws you shouldn't see in a game developed in this day and age. Other issues are the open world is lived in to an extent meaning it's not horrible but it isn't enough to keep you interested for more than 20 hours after completing the story. The story is the main reason to purchase this game one of the best in any video game. Didn't get off until I beat it no breaks it's that good. Recommend.

review:
Mafia 3 was great at the start, only to become extremely monotonous as you progressed towards the final missions. The combat is okay-ish and the missions get pretty repetitive, although achieving head-shots is EXTREMELY satisfying. What I did enjoy about the game was its narration style, the voice acting and cut scenes (which are brilliantly executed), and driving around town listening to old English classics.

Would only recommend purchasing it if you get a great discount.

review:
My rating: 7/10 - Good

I had a prejudice towards this game from the beginning and I have to admit that first 10-15 hours were somewhat monotonous and boring. I was also afraid that the game will not have such a strong character compared to the bar set by its predecessors - Mafia 1 and Mafia 2. Fortunately, it got somewhat better towards the end. I have to admit that most of the missions are considerably boring (it seems like developers tried to extend the story), however all of the main story missions were very entertaining, including DLCs. In the end I have to admit I was pleasantly surprised by the overall outcome. The music in the game is amazing, story makes sense, and by the time I finished it, I became attached to it as well as to its characters.

review: Nothing really special about it. Combat is boring, story missions are repetitive, and very buggy. Not sure what causes it but sometimes it will tell me to "talk to this person" and when i get there, there is no option to talk to them. A restart usually solves this but thats frustrating. Graphics seem buggy sometimes, earlier there was a huge gray streak across my screen and i believe it was supposed to be someones arm. I just played for a couple hours and had to do the restart to accept more missions and it said the cloud storage is not synced. I dont know if this is steams fault or a glitch with the game but i just wasted time playing because now i have to replay all that. I played mafia 2 a long time ago and i had high expectations for this but its a total flop, feels more like a cheap GTA spinoff than the mafia game i remember. Unless theres a great deal, i would def recommend a pass on this game

review:
A fun game that overstays its welcome a little by getting repetitive before it ends.

The gameplay is pretty average, the music is great, and the writing is excellent, but the average gameplay starts to wear a little thin by the hundredth time you're doing essentially the exact same objectives again. Stick through it for the writing.

review:
Mafia III: Definitive Edition

Hanger 13 didnt improve game , its bug still out there and all story cant play back , its an very empty city .

and this game dont have new game + mode , if you clear all story , then really game is over , the only thing left to you , is an boring empty city , no more enemy to kill , no more South 3K to kill .

no free side missions allow you to play again and again like Mafia II Jimmy DLC , no free enemy point allow you to attack again and again .

after clear all stages , you have only one thing to do : kill the police and kill the citizens .

for a sandbox game , this game is failed .

recommand you to buy Mafia II , not this .

review:
(This is the 3rd time I replay the game and first as a purchase)
Though the story, open world and missions are unremarkable, this is the closest an action game has ever been to emulating a John Wick fight scene as you stagger and execute your enemies with the most fluid 3rd person shooter combat I have played to date. Perfection would require better animations and weapon sounds (the pistols sound like literal pea shooters)

review:
Broken. It just broken. The issues from launch have not been fixed and apparently a 5700xt ISN'T powerful enough to run the game.. ahh yes, a current gen GPU cant run a 4 year old game.. what utter SHITE

The Launcher.. Jesus christ that things a cunt It refuses to stay in full screen
The game just REFUSES to stay in full screen. It will randomly lock up and its just broken on all fronts
I am sad to say this as the story and DLC have a really great set of writers behind them, but this game is just broken beyond repair. I have spent more time desperatly trying to get the fucker working than  playing.

Edit and update upon completion

Still broken. Seriously broken. But, the plot held me. I wanted to know what was going to happen. So excelent story writing, if you can follow the narative, and the payoff is excelent 
But unfortunately, i cannot recommend it

The bugs are just that bad

VERY DISAPPOINTED and money wasted at least let us revert back to old versions !!

review:
This review isn't really a definitive yes from me, but hear me out. There are a plethora of good things I can say for this game: 1. it introduces a wide array of interesting characters, 2. the story is excellent and provides a whole lot of cathartic moments for the player, 3. the world is beautiful and seeing a 60's Louisiana is pretty awesome. 4. period accurate events, such as segregation puts things into perspective and really gives a voice to the African Americans state of living. It all sounds great on paper, but here's the catch if you want to experience all this: the entirety of the gameplay loop being based solely on districts and racket busting (going to x and y, story, rinse and repeat). If I didn't really want to do the same bit a second time then I sure as hell wouldn't want to do it for the 20th time with the only difference being who I was killing, and even that wasn't all too different.
    While the gameplay was extremely tedious, I was able to blast through districts pretty fast (pro tip: switch up your gameplay styles to salvage at least some fun); it can be pretty mindless fun at times. And when all things were said and done, I've got to say that I enjoyed it. The DLC's that are included since this is the Definitive Edition allow for a much better experience and I think that it's what saved this game for me. I honestly got so excited to play Sign of the Times because of the whole investigation gimmick, which was basically L.A. Noire: Occult Edition, and I wasn't disappointed (by this DLC, nor the other 2). 
    Another thing I feel the need to address is the porting job. I felt the handling of the port has improved since other reviews have surfaced as the game has been patched of most of its bugs. While I have experienced some softlocks here and there, a simple checkpoint reload did the trick and didn't bother me all that much. The large amount of reviews and discussion I've read regarding the framerate issues and graphical bugs didn't really seem to affect me and I thought the game played at a respectable framerate and that it looked absolutely amazing with its lighting.
    Overall, while I think that the game had so much potential in the gameplay department and that it could have spent a lot more time in the R&D phase, it really shines with its storytelling, characters, and DLC. Play it, but be ready for a whole lot of repetition.

review: I really enjoyed the game on my first play through. Though, replaying the game after a couple of months, I realised that it is very repetitive and tedious. But, it captures and relives the 60's and really shows off what it was like and how it felt to be a black man/woman in those times. I will still recommend the game, but just know, the repetitiveness can get to you.

review:
Edit: I am playing Red Dead Redemption 2, which is a great game, don't get me wrong, but compared to Mafia 3 RDR2 looks and runs worse. Mafia 3 is one of the best games I have ever played, and it is certainly the most enjoyable driving game I have ever played. A moment of complete elation occurred in game recently when I smashed through a billboard of a  villainous character that showed up in the story moments earlier. It was a completely organic moment that was the result of me just exploring and enjoying the driving physics, and I was literally screaming with excitement at how awesome the moment was. This game does this so much to me that I have to call it one of the best games ever. It is fun. it is exciting. It is pure gameplay without exceptions. 

It's difficult for me to believe how good this game is after all the bad reviews. Mafia: City of Lost Heaven has always been my favourite game. Mafia 2 was slightly disappointing for me, but I'm glad a lot of people like it. I was avoiding playing this game until I realised that a certain percentage of people are going to rate this game negatively purely based on prejudice alone, so I decided to give it a try. Wow, simply wow. It's amazing, I'm blown away. Mafia has always been the quality to GTA's quantity, and this game follows suit by improving upon the open world crime format in almost every way. 

I could not even buy this game as it is unavailable in South Africa, probably due to it's racial themes, themes which are still relevant today, today now in 2020 more than ever. On the radio in the game you hear protesters call for a disarmament of the police. this is not a new issue. The brutality of the police is an issue that has persisted for generations. Mafia has always turned a serious light on crime and violence where GTA satirises it. The first game made me realise as a child how the police are just gangsters working for the larger mafia of the government, and this game really drives that point home.

This is an experience like none other. Buy it.

CONS

All that being said I wish the cops cared about speeding. In Mafia 1 cops would give you a ticket for speed or running a red light. Mafia 2 removed the feature where cops recognise running red lights, and Mafia 3 removed recognition of speeding. I don't understand why you would want to remove features from the game. Mafia 3 has a radar and every time you drive past a cop a blue line appears on the screen, so the system is perfectly set up for speeding and obeying traffic laws, but cops just ignore you, so you can drive however you want. It breaks immersion. I really hope Mafia 1 remake has these things

EDIT: The game makes up for some of the above issues with the introduction of zones of varying police intensity. In some neighbourhoods the cops do not care at all, in other neighbourhoods the cops will hunt you down simply for existing. It's an interesting paradigm that pleases both types of players, those who want a challenge and those who just want to relax.

review:
This game was great until the definitive edition update.
It became completely unplayable ! Why force an update on us if it isn't working at all ?
I experience the same bug as tr83dw at the launch I get a message saying my computer does not meet the system requirements for the game, which is not true I'm above even recommended requirements ! 
I wanted to buy Mafia Def edition as I never played the first opus but I don't think I'll take the chance...
You need to fix this !
Or at least allow us to reverse to the original edition.

review:
8/10

Finished the game without encountering any game-breaking bug. Had a blast with it too. I discovered that the game gets boring real quick if you guns blazing through the enemies just shooting from cover to cover as the game is too easy even on the hardest difficulty. My advice: go stealth. Takes way longer than it supposed to be to finish a mission, but at least you'd have fun.

The game is visually impressive, at least now that the glitches are fixed. I don't how the graphics are SUPPOSED to look like, on the initial release years ago. But, there are some noticeable graphical bug in the cutscenes and certain dark areas although it can be easily ignored but for me it was immersion-breaking experience, as if the repetitive missions weren't breaking enough. And don't bother looking at the mirrors. Trust me.

Get the Mafia Trilogy bundle. The individual game is not worth the price, even for an underrated game from 4 years ago.

review:
I really wanted to like this game, but it runs so poorly. Medium settings at 1080 I still get 40-45fps. Playable, I guess. 1440p gets me roughly 30-35fps again on Medium. 

I have an i7 6700k and a 1060 6gb along with 16gb of ram. I'm not expecting perfection from all my games but I was told I don't meet the minimum requirements when I launched the game...
Minimum requirements say the CPU should be at least a Intel I5-2500K, GPU should be at least a GTX 660. I most certainly meet that.

This is besides the repetitive gameplay that other players have pointed out. It's a shame because, again, I really wanted to enjoy this.

review:
OPEN WORLD MASTERPIECE

Fantastic game. Great graphics, much better than GTAV. Good physics. The story is engaging and well told. The collectible mechanics are entertaining as you keep visiting new places and getting to know the city, which is by itself a fantastic location. 

The shooting is also extremely well done, very satisfaying the punch of the weapon, the reaction to the hits of the targets, all well done in the mafia tradition, this way the shootouts are usually exciting and gruesome.

I really think big companies are spending money creating bad mouth reviews for some games they can perceive as threat. (*ejem Rockstar *ejem GTAV) Otherwise I can't understand the waves of hate some good and decent games generate. I'm one of those weirdos that being a fan of GTAIV, I did not like nor enjoy GTAV. While I'm having a blast with Mafia III.

Call me crazy.

BLMafia - 9/10

review:
Great story, lackluster in content compared to Mafia 2. Not the prettiest of games either and the performance is left to be desired still in most ways. Can't run this maxed out stably on a 3700x, 16gb RAM and an RTX 2080 without frame drops here and there. But it's better than it was. 

If you've not played it, I can recommend it alone for the story, but be aware, you thought GTA IV was a bad PC port? LOL, you're in for a wild ride with this one.
