review:
Its a good game don't get me wrong but, I am running a R5 3600x and a RX 5700XT OC with 16gb 3200mhz ram and somehow don't meet minimum specs?

I've had to cap it at 30fps on medium settings and vsynch on just to make the game somewhat playable, screen tears and slight lag. needs fixing as it is buggy
Its a bit clunky, and the missions are quite repetetive, but The story really gripped me and the shooting is very satisfying.

review:
TL;DR FOR PEOPLE THAT DON'T WANT TO READ MY BOOK-LENGTH REVIEW
This game is good, and treated very unfairly. If you want a good story with great shooting mechanics and don't mind repetitive mission structure, pick it up.

I got this game on its original release. and I hated, hated HATED it. The 30 fps lock, weird lighting, numerous bugs and strange textures. I played it for about 7 hours and refunded it, all while cursing Hangar 13 for "ruining the Mafia franchise."

Fast forward almost 4 years and I can now see how wrong I was. In that time there has been a few DLC released, an FPS unlock and numerous other patches. Yes, the story is VERY uneven, with lots and LOTS of cookiecutter missions that play out mostly the same, and YES there are countless bugs (some of them absolutely hilarious), but dig deep and you will find a diamond in the rough my friend.

First off, the soundtrack is phenomenal. A lot of beloved psychedelic songs from the late 60's are in here, with some Soul/Swamp Rock to really even out the 'Nawlins feel. You've got CCR,  The Searchers, Paul Revere and The Raiders, ? And The Mysterians, Count Five, Johnny Cash, Elvis, The Rolling Stones, Sam Cooke, The Animals and The Beach Boys to name some of the more famous artists included in the game. I will often find myself just driving around listening to the radio instead of doing missions, the soundtrack is that great. 

Second, the guns. There is a fantastical amount of pistols, rifles, subguns, shotguns and automatic rifles in this game, and all of them do a fine job at mowing down racists by the dozen. The sound effects for weapons in this game are vastly superior to Mafia II and really make firefights more enjoyable (since that's about 90% of the gameplay.) TIP: You want to have some of the most fun you can have with a video game firearm? Pick up the Exterminatore shotgun from the Arms Dealer and thank me later!

Third, the cars. Man there are some nice looking cars in this game, and rightly so, as the late 60's-early 70's was the best time for American car design. You will find the Corvette, Camaro, Shelby GT500, Shelby Cobra, Impala, Thunderbird and more prowling the streets of New Bordeaux. They brought back simulation handling from Mafia II, which makes driving at high speeds way more fun due to the terrible handling. I'm not too big a fan of the way some of the cars sound compared to Mafia II's excellent sound design, but this is a minor nitpick.

THE NEGATIVES: Real quick I'm going to run thru some bad points for this game so I don't come across as totally biased. The Stealth is INCREDIBLY BRAINDEAD. You play as the biggest motherf****r around and if you are crouching, people can't see you until you are within 5 feet of them. The gunplay is also hit or miss. Big weapons like the hunting rifle can be a 1-2 hit kill to the chest depending on whether or not the game feels like it at the moment. THE GLITCHES, OH MY F**KING GOD THERE ARE A LOT. One I can remember off the top of my head was blowing up two Mafioso mid conversation, only for their dialogue to keep going after they died, and after it ended, IT LOOPED AGAIN AND AGAIN until I left the area! Also, don't alt-tab this game a lot or your sound will die on you.

Overall, compared to my first experience with this game in 2016, it has come a long way. Is this a great game? No, but it is a GOOD GAME and nowhere near as bad as people say. If you can put up with grindy gameplay in service of a good story, I would say MAKE SURE YOUR PC MEETS THE SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS BEFORE YOU BUY! I personally have had no issues, but I know this has been widely reported so I wanted to add it here before I get flamed.

My rating:
7 Dead Racists out of 10

review:
Mafia III is a really cool and one-of-a-kind game. It's not for everyone, but for those who enjoy it, you're in for a treat.

Yes, the missions are repetitive, but if you enjoy the gunplay and gamepaly loop like I do, then it's not a problem.
Combat is viceral and gruesome, you will fall in a matter of a few bullets, and so will your enemies (However, some of the SMGs can feel pretty weak, especially at range).
The death animations before the ragdoll kicks in are incredibly brutal and realistic, which is a big part of why this game is so (sadistically) fun.

The story is realy cool and unique, yes it's a vendetta story, but the side characters introduced to you are very cool, however some are more fleshed out than others, which is sad.
The atmosphere and soundtrack is perhaps the best point of this game, but the graphics are also very wll made, aside from visual glitches which can happen quite often, unfortunately.

All in all, Mafia III is a very fun open-world game with a heavy focus on combat and its main cast of a handful characters, having a somewhat proper treatment.
However, if you don't like open-world games with repetitive, filler content, then you will have to pass on this one, mate.

8 out of 10, because the recent Definitive update gave all the DLCs for free, even to people who had only purchased the vanilla game.

review:
I can't speak to the "definitive edition," as I recently completed the previous deluxe version of this game in February of this year. The game is passable, with the voice acting delivery and characterization the strongest points of the game with strong deliveries by the performers. Against the game, many of the actual activities you are taking outside of the missions feel strongly like padding (collecting electronics). Additionally, the game feels like it would have benefited by a stronger focus on guided mission; the game did not feel like it benefited from the open world design. Indeed, the beginning hour or so of gameplay is the strongest part of the game (and also the least freeform). Many of the gameplay elements are passable but one is left with feeling like the game could have benefited from an additional year of development.

Overall, an okay game that I completed by sheer bloody mindedness.

Many of the gameplay elements are passable but one is left with feeling like the game could have benefited from an additional year of development.\n\nOverall, an okay game that I completed by sheer bloody mindedness.", "timestamp_created": 1590953229, "timestamp_updated": 1590953229, "voted_up": false, "votes_up": 1, "votes_funny": 0, "weighted_vote_score": "0.523809552192687988", "comment_count": 0, "steam_purchase": false, "received_for_free": false, "written_during_early_access": false, "primarily_steam_deck": false}

review:
Mafia 3 is not a great game, at points it isn't even a good one, but it is a game I enjoyed for the 20+ hours it took me to complete. Mafia 3 feels like a good AAA game that made it to the beta stage and then was released. The story is entertaining, well acted and directed, if a little generic, and there are glimpses of details and polish that would more often be found in better games. However, Mafia 3 also suffers from repetitive missions and, most detrimental, poor AI.

Repetitive mission structure is one of the main critiques that gets leveled at this game but I actually don't mind this too much. Each story mission has to be "unlocked" by doing enough damage to the criminal racket in the area to draw out the boss. This means you have to drive to areas, kill bad guys, and destroy or steal items. You'll be doing this a lot throughout the game, but it's very easy to make progress. It usually only takes a few minutes of driving around and getting into fun shootouts before you can progress to the main story missions which are fun and interesting, if a little under cooked. 

The definitive edition includes all the DLC which helps with this variety as well. All three DLC side-stories are unlocked pretty early on and you can tackle these in between the main missions. This is how I would recommend playing them, as they are all quite a bit different from the main game and unlock new gear for Lincoln. 

Overall, I'd recommend Mafia 3, but only if you're looking for a decent open world game with a unique setting and perspective, but can overlook some serious shortcomings. At around 10 dollars I'd say Mafia 3 is a good value and a good amount of fun. Much more than that, and you'll likely be disappointed.

review: I have 26 hours in the previous edition, and picked up all the extra dlc eventually for some extra cost.  The game ran poorly before on my potato pc but was playable at 720p 30fps.  Now it just doesn't work, sub 30 fps and the textures from the road and pavements etc seem to be missing.  So I quitted the game after 1 min and looked for the old edition to re-download so I could play it.  It has been removed.  This is just WRONG, I've been cheated out of roughly ¬£50.  Not every one can afford to drop hundreds on a new pc.  The game itself is a cheap GTA5 rip off, story is okay but too many repetetive tedious missions along the way with cops that don't react to your crime spree right in front of them.  I at least I got Mafia 2 DE again for free, miles better!

review:
Everything like the story, gunplay, driving (if you like a realistic approach) is great, but there's two things that SUCK.

1. The same exact racket missions over and over for the entire game, I could write an essay on them alone, but they are terrible.

2. It's a console port and is optimized like crap, so unless you have a pretty good machine the game will most likely be unplayable.

review:
Finally finished the game now that they fixed just about all of the bugs with the Definite Edition.

==============================
The positives:
==============================

+Great Story.
+Great Dialogue.
+Awesome main character.
+New Bordeaux is well designed. Each district has a different feel to it. There are lots of alleys that add depth to just about each city block. 
+Donovan.
+Some main and DLC missions are pretty good.
+Stellar voice acting.
+Decent firefights (brutal take downs and shooting people in the head never got old for me).
+Decent driving (the cars have a weight to them).

==============================
The negatives:
==============================

-Washed out graphics that otherwise ruin the atmosphere and feel of the town. The graphics just aren't sharp enough even with Nvidia sharpening filter. Lots of dull colors. 

-Atrocious sky box.

-Texture pop-in when driving too fast.

-To unlock most of the main missions you HAVE to complete REPETITIVE side missions (drive to the other side of town, take out a whole bunch of bad guys, repeat - you will do the same type of mission about 30-50 times).

-Repetitive OPTIONAL side missions (these are separate from the repetitive side missions that you need to complete to unlock main missions, but at least these are optional). Ex: steal 3 types of this car; steal 3 types of this boat....seriously?

-The AI is mediocre and is easily outsmarted

-Some of the side missions can be easily exploited: for instance, you infiltrate a racket where the bad guys dwell, you immediately take out the main target and then load the last checkpoint - that way you do not have to break out and escape goons and cops. I did that over and over again to save myself the time and sanity. After you load your checkpont you will spawn at the last safe house. 

============================
Overall, I loved playing as Lincoln Clay. He is definitely one of my favorite game protagonists. His story is the main reason to play the game. However, I had to spend most of the game listening to audio books and such. Driving back and forth and doing the same mundane missions just to see the rest of the story is a crappy game design to say the least.

There is just no reason to make the game any longer than it has to.

That's why Mafia 2 was so great, you just did the main missions and it never got boring

-Some of the side missions can be easily exploited: for instance, you infiltrate a racket where the bad guys dwell, you immediately take out the main target and then load the last checkpoint - that way you do not have to break out and escape goons and cops. I did that over and over again to save myself the time and sanity. After you load your checkpont you will spawn at the last safe house. 

============================
Overall, I loved playing as Lincoln Clay. He is definitely one of my favorite game protagonists. His story is the main reason to play the game. However, I had to spend most of the game listening to audio books and such. Driving back and forth and doing the same mundane missions just to see the rest of the story is a crappy game design to say the least.

There is just no reason to make the game any longer than it has to.

That's why Mafia 2 was so great, you just did the main missions and it never got boring", "timestamp_created": 1590903852, "timestamp_updated": 1590946231, "voted_up": true, "votes_up": 0, "votes_funny": 0, "weighted_vote_score": 0.5, "comment_count": 0, "steam_purchase": false, "received_for_free": false, "written_during_early_access": false, "primarily_steam_deck": false}

review:
Awful. How can this have been released after GTA V? Now that I've played both Mafia 2 Definitive Edition and this I can say that Mafia 2 somehow has better graphics. 
The draw distance is absolutely butchered: any building more than 20m away will make Counter-Strike 1.6's textures look like art. Somehow this game doesn't have borderless windowed despite the fact that Mafia 2 has this option???

I find the gunplay entertaining enough, but that's as much as I can give this game. The gameplay is repetitive and will likely tire you out before you can finish it. DLC is a necessity to break the monotony of this game, which is okay given they packaged definitive with all the DLC. Fans of the series also have to keep in mind that this is not a "Mafia" game. It escaped the original purpose of the series and does not function as a "climbing the criminal hierarchy" game. Unfortunately, not only did it escape the series premise, it also executed the new premise terribly from a gameplay perspective. Story is ok.

However, this is simply not worth the price. Buy Mafia 2: Definitive or wait for Mafia: Definitive Edition.

review:
I never played Mafia 3 before. 

So i got the definitive edition for something like 10 dollars on mmoga and i have to say..

Solid game really! The main story is quite good and the open world with it's sidequests is repetitive but funny. There is much to do, a way more than in mafia 2 for example.

Even with it's glitches the graphics especially the lightning is stunning and atmospheric. The overall world design is really pretty.

Cars looking and feeling insanely good, i always caught myself driving down the street's instead of doing missions.

Soundtrack is one of the best things in the game too.

Even today there are some bugs left like lightning glitches, animation Problems or the strange mirrors. But "nothing" was gamebreaking for me.

I definitely can recommend the game for the price i had.
Its not a bad game at all!

review:
So, i've been playing it personally for a while now.....
If before i though it's not THAT BAD when i saw full gameplay on the youtube.... now i know that i was completely wrong.

So what do i think.... the biggest issue is that this game are concentrated on racism not because it was everywhere in 1960-70s, and not in the sake of atmosphere, but because it's current standarts for last 6 years for a game - let's make all white people bad and helluva racist (even if current people have nothing with stuff that was going on back then)

Let's get stright to the problems of this game - the story itself and technicall issues.

[b]1) Not following concepts of Mafia (aka Cosa Nostra)[/b]

Let's slide stright into the most breaking moment in the whole concept - Lincoln Clay [u]taking a role of Don in MAFIA HIERARCHY.[/u] Which is on a moment [u]ITALIANS ONLY.[/u] Pardon me but.... that's just beyond stupidity. 
I'm not saying that Lincoln are completely bad character. I'm saying that his "mafia membership" makes 0 sense.

[b]*SPOILER ALERT* DUH[/b] (it's not like this game are 4 years old)
[spoiler] The fact that Leo Galante himself admitted that Lincoln can sorta "join" Mafia if he'll keep money rollin.... fucked me in the brain. In Mafia 2 Leo and Frank Vinci where those last people in The Commission who were trying to keep the traditions of old times. And now, he, as the part of The Commission accepts non italian in their organization.... Righty'o, why not. [/spoiler]

[b]I don't recall that Lincoln are italian.[/b]

[u]American rednecks[/u] that taking part in [u]Marcano's Italian crime organisation?[/u]
Excuse me? i mean, yeah, they might be associates (lowest step in hierarchy, that are basically not a part of the "family" but associated with them) but it's pretty much looks like they are Marcano's soldiers (2nd step in hierarchy, at this point they are a part of the family) or even more - partners which is makes no sense because it's been told by real world gangsters that guy of another nationality, but pure italian, couldn't get a step higher than associate.....(and it was followed in 1st and 2nd games)

Also endless racism..... i mean, yeah, south of the US are famous for their radical views, but jesus christ Hangar 13 don't you think that you pushed things slightly too far?

[b]Conclusion #1[/b]
What did Hangar 13 with whole concept that illusion softworks were working on? Right, they wrote it on the paper, took a huge dump, and wiped themselfs using that paper. 
Why they did that? Obviously because this game doesn't fit current fashion and standarts, italian crime organisation, doesn't seem a good concept. Let's make it inernational. #fucklogic

[b]2) Technical issues.[/b]
I mean, i don't think i can write anything new, but hell....

[b]Soap.[/b]
Just lot's of a fucking soap. And you can't do shit about it. It's just soapy as fuck.

[b]Car physics[/b]
Well, what do you need to know about Car Physics in this game that it's buggy as fuck. You can sit in the car, close the door, and then BOOM it'll jump into the air will do a caouple of barrel rolls and land on it's roof. Cause why fucking not?

[b]Ragdoll and prop physics[/b]
It might be not that much important at the first look, but game ment to be believable 1960s. But every time you shot someone, and that guy just getting froze in time and space and just keep standing there, dead...... 
Or better example. Group of people standing in the cirlce drinking beer. Gunfight happens nearby, that group getting scared and runing away. "And what's wrong with that?" you'll ask me. Beer bottles that group drop. Those bottles will just remain hanging in the air. Perfect.

[b]Conclusion #2[/b]
Gameplay are getting fucked up by constantly popping up bugs. Fucked up vision, fucked up physics.... They are just countless.


[b]Thoughts[/b]

What do i think... well, this game would be better as a side story, set in mafia universe with some of improvements to the story and Vito's cameo. But whole concept that non italian guy are going solo-yolo revenge againt Italian-redneck organisation people of which constantly using racial slurs..... In my eyes - it's doesn't work as a "numbered" part of the series.

[b]Verdict[/b]
[u]This game are absolute trash at almost everything.[/u]
[list]
[*]Shooting feels like you are using bb guns and shoting plasticine targets.
[*]Stealth are ultra basic.
[*]Driving are glitchy.
[*]Attention to the details that had not hard impact to the gameplay but add charm to it (for which mafia games being loved for, especially the original) are moastly tossed into the shitter.
[*]Animation inconsistency. On one moment, Lincoln doing a move to rich a knife behind his back, do the execution, and then *POOF* knife are just disappearing from the hand.
[*]Too many tips on the HUD, such as markers that pop on the road. i mean, yo, i can read the map you know, i ain't blind.
[*]Story are pretty poorly worked out and most of the concepts (for example - Vito's appearance) were dragged by the balls and nailed to the wall. Even hugeass charismatic Donovan couldn't save the whole situation.
[/list]

P.s. I'm worried about remaster of the original Mafia. Pretty sure they are going to cut lot's of content. Not sure how many of Dev's left in Hangar 13 who were working on original mafia games 1 & 2. But something tells me - everything going to go down the shitter, becasue it looks like 2k Czech(Hangar 13 now) lost their head when Daniel Vavra left them.

P.p.s. All above my personal opinion and you don't have to bee agree with everything.

review:
Mafia 3 is a great game stuck in a mediocre one. There's a lot to love here, especially the story. 

Only buy this game if you are willing to put up with repetitive gameplay, bugs and general clunkiness to experience a fantastic story with some amazing setpieces.

review: This game has a good story that is let down by horrible execution, same could be said for many mafia games but the blurry graphics and weird bugs that sometimes glitch out entire missions? That and the horribly repetitive action. Combined, this game is not worth its full price, my recommendation is to but the trilogy on sale maybe, but that is only if you are assuming the mafia remake is good and that this game is just a nice bonus on the side.

review:
My positive recommendation for this game is tied strictly to the storytelling and that some of the missions have cool locations and decent gunplay. The actual technical performance of this game on PC is pretty pathetic. I have an excellent PC with a Ryzen 3800x, 16Gb of 3466Mhz DDR4 RAM, and an RTX 2080 TI video card and this game somehow can barely keep up a decent framerate most of the time. It also suffers from incredibly near object pop in and LOD graphical glitches that sometimes can make whole objects like cars appear uncomfortably close in front of you in traffic when you're driving at speed. The game has been a mess since launch and it is no different now.

If you're willing to fight through some issues, there is a pretty fun crime drama to be had here that really uses the setting and an interesting cast of diverse characters of all walks of life to weave an impressive story. I just wish that it didn't come with so many caveats.

review:
I have managed to log roughly 66 hours of gameplay with Mafia 3 and thoroughly enjoyed every second. Sure, much like previous reviews some of the content was buggy in places but the story was captivating enough to make it worth while. Ill say again  I really really enjoyed this game and had started purchasing dlc to expand my need for more story line.

Content is great but again buggy in places. Roll on to the definitive update. 

I was able to run the game on low to mid settings and have a very nice looking and smooth running game. The new update has now made the game entirely unplayable, it looks horrible kinda cartoony in ways and generally I am  just extremely annoyed  that the game I loved to play has become something that i now frown at when i see in my games list. 

In my honest opinion, i think the devs done a really neat thing by giving me the update for free, it was a grand gesture, but it would mean a whole lot more if i could use the game to any benefit. 

I probably wont download another game from this dev in fear that they will later ruin my gaming experience with unexpected game changing updates. 
if there is a way for me to go back to playing this game without this update could someone please point me in the direction of how i do that

review: One of the worst PC ports in history, I had to troubleshoot the game just to get it to start and that was only the beginning. The controller sensitivity is maxed out no matter what setting you set it to, the graphics sometimes won't load all the way making the game look like playdough, it has awful screen tearing and these are all the things you have to deal with before you can even start to play the actual game. The "Definitive Edition" is an actual joke 2K doesn't give a fuck about selling you a working game they just want your money.

review:
I tried this on PS4 through Redbox, but I just couldn't get into it when it came out. I noticed I got the Definitive Edition as I had Mafia 3 from Humble Bundle so I decided to check it out this week. It's the same as before sadly. The charecters are really great with a good story. However, it's all bogged down by the same mission structure.

1. Talk to someone
2. Disrupt acitivies in the area. (Steal money, beat up some people, steal money, etc)
3. Talk to the same person again
4. Kill the boss
5. Take over the boss's stuff by calling one of three people
6. Move to another district
7. Repeat

It's so boring. Not only that but the combat has a lot to be desired. I hope the team learns from this if a Mafia 4 is indeed coming as I just can't recommend any games if they are like this.

review:
Still terrible performance as on standard Mafia 3 version... My god... so my question is... what's the differences between standard Mafia 3 and definitive edition???... because if only one difference is that definitive Edition includes all previous DLC's so it's sad... because before, on standard Mafia 3 version of the game, i had all DLC's as well.  So at least i've expected so see in this "improved version" of the game, some kind of bug fixes, or huge performance improvements... and now it's same product just repacked... makes me a bit sad, and angry... i don't want to be disrespectful or something, but facts are facts... it's same bad FPS, same bad performance, and my CPU is always rocking sky high stuck at 100% usage... Please be a good kiddos, and fix your product... i still like this game, and still trying to play even with this terrible performance... that's why this makes me angry, i cannot properly enjoy the game... 

P.s - for people which thinking to buy this game, i could not recommend this game... unless they fix a performance issues, and the some of the bugs... buy it with a huge discount, on sale some kind. I've played both versions: standard, and definitive edition, and collected a plenty of time to make decision about this game.

review: Beneath the buggy, flawed mess that is Mafia III: Definitive Edition, there is a very enjoyable story with amazing writing and interesting characters. With that being said, I'm going to positively review this game. I feel that it deserves to be experienced for story alone. However, I feel that it should only be purchased at a discount price. The game is absolutely fucked. I don't think it's nearly as messed up as the Mafia II "Definitive Edition", but it's still riddled full of glitches and bugs. I spent around 40 hours playing the "Definitive Edition" of Mafia III, and with that time--I witnessed perhaps some of the most incredible bugs I've ever seen in a video game to date. To name a few: NPCs and cars falling through the map, environments and textures not loading, NPCs holding invisible guns, clothing disappearing (leaving Lincoln looking like some kind of horrifying glitch monster), infinite loading screens...the list goes on. Ignoring the issues that may never be fixed, like I said--the game has a really good story. If you can get passed the repetitive open world content and ridiculous bugs, I feel that the game is still worth picking up.

review:
Firstly, it's an excellent surprise to see the Definitive editions of both Mafia II and III for those that owned it, and not going all epic exclusive for a year and betraying the owners *cough saints row cough*

Secondly, this game has excellent DLC unlike Mafia II's glitchy horrible mess. The entire game has excellent voice acting that gets you hooked, and the facial animations are truly realistic, even a cough causes a character's cheeks to puff.

The AI can be stupid sometimes, the sounds could have been balanced better, and fast travel could have been added, even in the form of taking a taxi, it would've been appreciated.

The definitive edition does basically nothing to the main game of Mafia III but add the DLC in for free and an ad to pre-order the upcoming Mafia remake on the main menu, I do enjoy this game, and hope that Hangar 13 has learned from few mistakes in this game in order to improve on the Mafia remake.

Maybe an online savegame error. Anyway I will never play again. This game is okay but has a lot of bugs and glitches. Unreliable gamesaves make the game useless. I bought it a long time ago or I would have asked for a refund.

review: This game is very hit or miss for me. Mafia has always been something ive loved and i had very high hopes for this game. But when it came out it was a total mess a lot of bugs and things that just didn't work. Now after all the updates and texture fixes i still see a lot of those issues but the game is playable. The story is pretty good i enjoy the story i enjoy the time period the gun play and hell even the driving most of the time. This game leaves a lot to be desired. But is a bad game fundamentally no there are a lot of things that piss me off but i can see past a lot of them !

review: I am one of the few people that actually really liked Mafia III. I have owned the ps4 and xbox one copies previously but never played on pc. When this came out i was excited to finally play on my 2080ti, however, this version of the game has so many issues. First of all, controller support is terrible. I have had issues with both the ps4 and xbox one controllers even through steam's config. Both controllers constantly stop responding in game constantly forcing me to reload the game. I have tried several different inputs and all of them have messed up right stick sensitivity. I have to turn both mouse and controller sensitivity down to 0.5 in order for it to work. Also, this version has way more glitches than any version i have played. Textures don't load properly, enemies get stuck in walls and some missions are broken that i have to reload the game in order to progress. It was never a perfect game and had more of its share of issues, but how do you cause more issues? Re-releasing a game is one thing, but re-releasing it with more problems than before??? I'm not sure what they were thinking. Don't waste your $30 and just buy the Mafia 1 remake when it comes out.

review: The gameplay is repetitive and checkpoints awful. For example you have to destroy 3 targets which take maybe 10 min each but if you die at third target it checkpoints back to begining of mission so have to start over, it punishes the player. makes the game frustrating not fun. These morons do not know how to make a fun game. The combat is trash, third person is clunky and have limited ammo. The missions are repetitive and you come to a point where you just run to target because cannot be bothered to spend 15-20 min clearing out enemies over and over . There is mission where you have to steal a truck, if you die it spawns you 10 min away, I quit the mission because was a chore just to get back to it, this is just an example of how the devs have no clue on how to make a game fun, the mission would have been fun but these idiots decide to spawn the player far away for no reason other than punish the player.  Cops will always know exactly where you are and no matter how you drive they will be on your bumper like they have a gps on your car and no matter what turn you make they will be there like they teleported and if outrun the cops by going bushes or hiding they will find you like they have a tracker on you.  Enemies are bullet sponges and the handgun is useless, I shot enemy in head 3 times and still came at me. Games like this makes me appreciate GTA games even more.  This game will ruin mafia series  and no wonder it sold poorly, hopefully these dev clowns get out of the game business and never do another game so we as consumers do not have to endure garbage like this for $60 ever again. Only positive is the acting and story is top notch but not enough to save this.

review: All these years i hated the game so much , that i did not give it a chance , a real one , but the game is actually not bad. I'm a big mafia fan , it's not the best but it deserves your time. Maybe the only reason i gave it another shot is, because of Vito. We all know Mafia II is a legendary game which ending was insane, that's why i finished the third game.The story is not that bad , the endings also and the different ways of playing the game affect the future which is cool , making your own story in a way. If u have the time give it a go. 6/10

review:
Not the greatest game in the "Mafia" series of games ( that would be "Mafia 2" ) - but still, lot of fun. Great story, great characters, the best overall combat and stealth mechanics in the whole series of Mafia games.

The downside is that there's not much to do in the world of Mafia III apart from killing enemies, and doing side-missions over and over again. Still. It ain't a bad game, mainly due to its really good story and actually nice combat and stealth. It's just that, if you get bored killing people in this game, there isn't much else to do. Unlike say, In GTA. Would recommend it tho, especially now that all DLC are included in the bundle.

review:
Mafia III is a funny game, funny in that the second to second gameplay is amazing; Probably the most satisfying combat you'll ever experience in a videogame, the minute to minute gameplay is awfully repetitive; you'll speed across the map to clear out another racket or do a fetch quest over and over and over again, but the hour to hour gameplay is oddly satisfying; Progressing the story to that next gorgeous cutscene and taking over the city can feel quite rewarding.

The DLCs help incredibly to break up the repetitiveness of the campaign. Unfortunately all three are available to you as soon as you assemble your allies and it can be quite tempting to burn through them all rather quickly. I suggest you play them in the order they released, but only play one after you take over a district in the main story, so it feels like there is some time that passes between these mini campaigns and they're not crammed one after another.

I would also suggest you vary the gunplay, try out as many guns as you can and don't be afraid to swap during combat from your favourite gun/s, it keeps combat fresh. Now if the gameplay was all you were worried about, that portion of the review is over, the next brief section is on the story.

As some other reviewers have mentioned, the story doesn't feel very 'Mafia-esque' , quite the contrary, you don't join a family and rise through it's ranks, you instead destroy one, tearing it to the ground as a kind of 'One Man Army'. Lincoln Clay doesn't even fix back up the black mob to replace it. He just divides the city between three mob bosses, with him as the head-honcho. Whole story starts to feel quite 'circle-jerky' towards the end. The cutscenes for this game, however, are by far the best I have seen in a videogame, almost like they outsourced the mo-cap to a film studio.

Finally, and this is more of a personal gripe with the game, the number of dead bodies Lincoln leaves in his wake is quite ridiculous, making him and his revenge story very hard to sympathize with. I've played through Mafia II recently as the definitive addition just came out and Vito/The Player maybe killed 150 people over 10 in-game years. I swear by the end of Mafia III, Lincoln must have murdered 1000 people in "a couple months" (according to an in-game trial).

In spite of all that, the game is still worth a play-through, it has it's highs and lows, but can really come together if you can look past it's faults. I don't want you thinking the game isn't worth a play-through just because of that Story-based rant at the end. Buy on sale, you probably won't regret it.

review: I really Enjoyed playing his game and would recommend purchasing it. Yes several of the missions can get repetitive but this just gives you the opportunity to complete the missions in a different way you can choose stealth attacks or dropping grenades on the enemy which is always fun. This game did not have the same feel as Mafia 2 a game which I really enjoyed but it was an enjoyable game. The bad guys where we fleshed out as racist a**holes so when you blew them away it made the game play that much more satisfying. I recommend purchasing this game but would wait for it to be on sale.

review:
+ Fantastic and well selected music
+ Highly destructive enviroment
+ Story and its characters are worthy of attention
+ World feels alive, one of the best enviroments I have seen in a game
+ Engaging sound effects
+ About 48 firearms plus another 7 throwable weapons you can buy for ingame currency
+ Relevant ingame currency that feels important through the whole game (with high difficulty)
+ Adequate DLCs adding more weapons, cars, clothing and new great stories
- Old bugs untouched and new bugs are present
- Buggy cutscenes (stucked animation, missing characters)
- Steam, DS4 or Nintendo Switch Pro controllers sometimes bug ingame interface (no button prompts icons, bugged unlocking minigame)
- Washed out and blurry post process effects
- Extremely dumb and non-adaptive enemy AI (absurd cover choices and pathfinding)
- Repetitive missions, quest giver can actually send to the exact same 4 miles away place TWICE IN A ROW (WHAT THE FUCK)
- Cheating police AI doing 180¬∞ turns on spot to not get stuck in enviroment and to substitute terrible pathfinding (visible on minimap or from further distance)
- Minimalizing or using Steam overlay often breaks the whole game and has to be restarted (missing sounds, glitched cutscenes)
- Deleted radio songs without any substitution (expired licenses)
- Game sometimes crashes randomly, no matter what hardware you have
- Any crime you do, police just shoot you (huge downgrade in comparison with older Mafia titles)
- No close combat weapons
- No modding support

Game is technically in a state of early-access title. Technical disaster.
However for me it felt it was worth playing for its setting, enviroment, music and story.
Mafia III could be easy 9/10 without bugs and repetitive missions, but in this DEFINITIVE state it's more like 6/10 experience.

review:
As a huge fan of the Mafia series (Mafia II is one of my favorite games of all time), I was really excited when Mafia 3 was announced back in 2015. I thought, "Wow! We are finally going to get to see the continuation of the story from the cliffhanger that Mafia II gave us."

Man, I really wish that was the case.

I'll just go ahead and list the Pros and Cons of this game. I'll start off with the Pros since it's the one with the...least amount of things.

PROS - Great shooting & cover mechanics, awesome setting, soundtrack atmosphere, interesting story characters. 

Now the cons.

CONS - Boring, extremely repetitive missions, muddy graphics, poor game design (guns run out of ammo too quickly, you cannot find ammo except on dead gangsters), LACK OF CONTENT (no houses, garage, gun shops, clothing shops, no restaurants to buy food from) Lack of gameplay features (no robberies, stickups, or activities outside of story & DLC missions). Car physics are underwhelming, especially for a Mafia game. Very buggy and has glitches, even in the re-release. DLC's are short, brief, and mostly unmemorable. "Definitive" edition adds nothing except for tweaks and graphics fixes that should've shipped with the game almost 4 years ago. 

VERDICT: For a game that had five to six years of development time, I cannot understand how it could end up like this. It is incomplete, and developers should've been given more time. It's not a horrible game, but pales in comparison to it's predecessors. Buy this game if it's on sale for really cheap, or buy it as part of the Mafia Trilogy. Do not buy it standalone.

review:
Maffia III: Definitive Edition. 
As a long time player of the Maffia series, this one is by far the worst of the three, The story is really boring and the whole maffia vibe is just pretty much gone. The gameplay feels stiff and not really solid but Maffia 2 had this problem also, The character you play is not as interesting as Vitto and the optimization of the game well let's just say its not there it runs pretty bad even on a high-end gaming PC and the graphics aren't even that high or nice sure it does like nice sometimes but the maffia 2 Definitive edition does look nicer sometimes and that says a lot... The content you get is also really repetitive. Kill a guy, took over a camp ,steal money took over the HQ call your gang and cutscene that your gang arrives and this is just what you get. You have some fun collectibles sure but the main gameplay is just straight-up boring. 

The driving also feels just clunky and not as solid as in Maffia 2 the NPC's are full-on stupid the stealth mode works like garbage and I could go on and on but I think you get the picture. 

I can't really say anything positive about this game I hope they do better on the next maffia..

Maffia III: Definitive Edition 3.5/10

review: What was a fun, engaging game has been seriously marred with the "upgrade" to Definitive Edition.  Random crashes are now the norm, and having to restart from checkpoint is pretty consistent as objectives are non-responsive when you arrive.  I used to really enjoy this game, so much so that I bought it on Xbox and PC.  Now?  Well, it needs serious work.

review:
Terrible Mafia, Bad Game.

Finally, an open world game on the Gulf Goast. Finally, a game in the southern US. Finally, a slice of louisiana in it's old glory.
But nope, it's a giant fuckup and a huge letdown. And this "definitive" isn't changing a damn thing.

First, game is not optimized at all. Since launch in 2016 it has constantly run into issues (capped framerates, overbloom, fucked reflections, framerates falling, cutscenes not working...). This "Definitive" hasn't done anything towards that, just brings even more bugs.

Second : the constant lazyness. It took everyone to moan everywhere for them to add the BASIC features : Clothes, Car customisation (And it's still limited to the bunch of cars you can get delivered),... And yet, they still scrapped all Mafia II's feature. An open world with nothing inside
[H1]The game just bashes over and over and over that "Lincoln is a n*gern, so shops owners won't sell him anything or even tolerate him inside, and police will always try to shoot him[/h1]. And there you go about why there isn't any shops, restaurants, or even the police mechanics that made them try to ticket you or arrest you instead of straight up shooting for running a red light.

In that regard, the game is just being plain racist. There is a ton of disclaimers, cultural team accurate depiction etc... But in reality they're just condescending the main character as an amorphic pariah that can't do anything or do anything normal, and when he does it should be praised. That's racism 101. Not the characters and lines, but this differenciated treament of the character.

What is left then for the immersion ? Good old cars all shiny with chrome, V8 and tire bursts ? Don't count on that. Unlike Mafia II which made car driving challenging yet fun, in Mafia III they're just meres soapboxes that will replay the same tire-screeching sound (How did they recorded it ? Pulling a chair on a floor ?) for no reason, absolutely no weight, and however lightly you press the K, lincoln will hammer the sh*t out of it and spin you to hell. The driving is made difficuly only by it's retarded spinning and the imput lag when doing anything (Turning, Braking, Acceleration). Cars are without any personality. Completely forgettable. Even those unnamed 10 cars from The Godfather II had more personality, charm, and more polished sounds than those in Mafia III. I can't remember any of their name nor have any want to drive any, as they all have the same soapbox physics.

Gunfight maybe ? Nope. Pass on. Where Mafia II had a simple but efficient melee combat, there is none of it in Mafia III. And where the second was entirely playable with a Pistol, from the beginning to the endgame, without much difficulties, Mafia III is just yet another modern shooter where pistols are airsoft guns, ennemies are bullet sponges and you have to rely on heavier guns just for the ammo capacity. Also, no efforts where made either on the sounds, it's the same unrealistic one for all guns.

Yet there was no problems recycling some Mafia II assets. While you cannot customise the numbers on your licence plate anymore, you're given the choice between a few pre-mades (Even HNGR13 and 2KCZCH, but why would you want to drive around with the name of those games ruiners splaterred into your face all day long, especially with such a close up camera), the models are straight up recycled from Mafia II, to the point they didn't bothered to fix the EXACT. SAME. Expiration date, still showing 23 Feb 1953,  despite the game takes place in 1968.

And finally, about the story. What story ? There is just no story at all in this game. Past the introduction begining, there will be absolutely no missions or assisgment that are unique and stands up until the 6 district bossfight, and the final "Shoot everyone" mission. There is 6 districts where you do exactly the same, over and over and over : Talk to the 2 persons in charges of the operations, interogate a henchman for each that will tell you about all the things going on, then just destroy the targets (Driving vehicles, crates in warehouses) over and over and over again until you reach a "Damage $" threshold for both that unlocks the operation boss, which you can kill or capture. And then only, you can play the long-waited instanced district-boss mission, before doing the same 5 others times, and magically unlocking the bridge to the endgame.

TL;DR : Mafia III tried to be an open world game, but scrapped everything that contributed to it in Mafia II, leaving a blank, empty canvas with nothing to do than the EXACT. SAMES. MISSIONS. for the entierety of the game.
Also, [spoiler] Vito became a giant wuss with a death wish, that won't stand up for anything, even his own life, and will be fine living in misery[/spoiler]. And [spoiler] The girl ending is basicly muh strong empowered black women who don't need no boss that kills most of the country's criminal rings leader, and shots the governor until the Government cut off the city completely, and Kathrina turns it into ruins[/spoiler]

Thanks Hangar for not only ruining Mafia's series, but only coming back to profanate Mafia I and II.

review:
7.5/10
Pros: Great music, nice graphic details, charismatic characters, interesting side missions. Brutal kills can be awesome, also ending of more than few missions are so satisfying. Proper looking cars, proper music, it takes you back to the time after war in Vietnam. It has a nice story.
Cons: 
* Boring main missions. They are so repetitive. You beat up informer, kill enforcers, destroy mini bosses workplace, make them work for you, give districts to one of 3 of your under-bosses and game over.
* Story has nothing to do with mafia. This is GTA after war in Vietnam. Story is good, but it is not mafia story.
* Bugs! So many bugs made by the same guys who are asking now for 50$ for reworked Mafia I game. (Unable to pass true security in boxing mission, max 60 fps if you want to play with useless v-sync, unable to load from Full Screen - I had to load game window mode to pass first few videos before menu window where I would switch back to full screen again... so on)

I don't see myself ever coming back to this game, because how boring main missions are.

review:
On one hand, I really think its cool they tried with an unusual setting here. While the first Mafia games were set in the time of the prohibition and the post war era respectively. This one takes place in the South in the late 60s, and it could have been great. 

Could have, if the game was any better. I tried it twice... once a few months after it originally came out, when it kept crashing and performing really badly. Now I tried it again, and even though it seems to perform a tiny bit better... it still is a very very average game, so all I can say is "meh". Who knows, may become fun later, but I have not the slightest intention to continue playing, as this is just clunky and messy. 

Great idea, subpar execution, unfortunately.
Still broken, still looks like shit in motion. STAY AWAY

review:
Not sure why people don't like this iteration of the Mafia series? The story is compelling and whilst it's your a-typical underdog making it big (and what mafia story isn't?) the racial tensions of the period makes the main story more interesting and introducing an old Vietnam buddy also makes this a bit more compelling than just gangsters out for themselves.  

The game-play seems to me the same as the other Mafia games,  driving (handles fine) and shooting (aim up and pull the trigger) and beating the crap (pressing that Q key at the right time for some cool take-downs) out of people is the norm, a few bugs when I fist purchased the game on release seem to have been ironed out with the DLC and updates. (You may still encounter some weird physics when crashing cars, but that all part of the fun).

Overall I enjoy Mafia III and I am looking forward to see if there is a IV.

Choppy, laggy, no textures, etc. It says my computer doesn't have the specs to run it, even though there was never a single problem in the entire 32 hours I played before the update. Don't buy this game unless they fix it and make it playable again. Would appreciate a response from the developer/publisher, because a lot of people are having the exact same problems I am.

If they are going to rebox a game at least they could have sorted out the game breaking UI bugs and not taken a huge leap backwards to Mafia I level graphic quality.

Gameplay wise there isn't anything to write home about.

review:
If you're looking for a conclusion to Vito's Story from MAFIA II then this game is for you. 
This game is universally known to be a letdown when it comes to it's potential and what could have been.  If you take away the repetitive gameplay loop that overstays it's welcome, The whole appeal of this game it's presentation when it comes to storytelling and making you feel like a powerful mob boss. However, there are better mafioso games out there for sure.

review:
After about 50+ hours of game time I finished the story as well as DLC(bonus points for giving all the base game owner DLC for free with release of Definitive Edition). There are some issues with the game as well as some straight up weird design choices, but that's what every game has, so all you can do is either get used to it or not play it, for me the pros outnumber cons by a mile.

Main issues the game has come from a couple of things, first being it's a console port, meaning graphical downgrade is thanks to our "pals" on consoles, which means any game that comes from there is going to look like crap unless it's basically remade again fro PC market, which sadly a lot of companies cannot do. The other set of issues comes from the fact that it's an open world game, and just like 99% of open world games it has filler content, which can feel very tedious and repetitive if you do it all in one go, instead you should mix and match that content so it feels fresh as you play.

Weird design choices I noticed that bothered me the most were concrete bushes/small trees, the fact that bulletproof vest is used if you're driving a car and hit something, or fall from a higher place, it's obviously an HP booster, but they masked it badly, and probably the worst one of all, "invisible walls" so to speak, areas of interest/mission areas are usually walled off, and there are spiked/barbed wire walls that cannot be crossed no matter what, which forces you to go through one of the few scripted entrances, it really makes replayability of said areas smaller as you're funneled to the entrances they wanted you to go through.

Story in the game is a classical tale of revenge, there are choices as well as different endings corresponding to how you played and what you chose. The game boils down to you taking over a district for one of the friendly mob groups and then moving forward to other districts so you can take them all down before striking the mob boss. It can and will feel repetitive if you just do these things without doing any of the side content in between, as it's a simple formula copy-pasted throughout the game, apart from main missions that take place usually after taking out a district. Now these missions and moments where your actions are followed by one of the songs included are really memorable, you get all pumped up and ready for action, and they are very well done.

There are collectibles, in fact, a lot of different ones, which don't count for any of the achievements but you will most likely want to get them all, as they're interesting, to say the least. Main categories consist of Playboy magazines, Vargas paintings(topless woman art), album covers(from the in game music, which is banger, authentic as well), propaganda posters, Hot Rod magazines and repent magazines.

Downloadable content brought in different items as well as mechanics, one of them has you investigating cultist areas, the other brings you to a tropical island so you can take back the nuclear warhead from the terrorists and the last one sends you to free the people who racist sheriff and his cops are harassing and killing. They're fairly short but now that we got them for free I can't complain.

If you like open world games you'll probably like this, there are no other games with the same setting as far as I know so that's a big plus too, you'll get a lot for your money if you're willing to "grind" for it, as even the main story will take you a while to do.

review: I have a Mac that goes above the specs of  the presented minimum requirements. This game caused the right of my iMac's screen to flicker. Something that has NEVER happened before and I can play most games on full/advanced graphic settings such as Elder Scrolls Online. I had to uninstall. I enjoyed Mafia 2 in the past with no issues on a lower end Mac, but I had an issue years ago where this game (Mafia 3) would freeze on my current Mac. I ultimately ended up getting a refund, decided to try again this month to see if they fixed the glitch. The game worked but then my right screen starts turning black and flickers and it lingers even after you exit the game. I can ONLY reproduce this malfunction with this game, and it has again... NEVER EVER happened to my computer before and I use advanced programs such as Logic Pro, play games on full settings such as Elder Scrolls Online and etc. You probably have to have an iMac Pro or Mac Pro to play this game

review: Criminally underrated. Has the best gameplay out of any Mafia game in the series. Great sound track, good story. It's up to par and better than the other mafia games. Don't listen to that repetitive gameplay BS. There's plenty to do with the DLC and the gameplay is enjoyable, so any repetition is a good thing. The variety of brutal takedowns in this game alone is enough to flush out and repetitive complaints. Story is up to par, not any buggier than other Mafia games. It's an exception game and worth full price.

review:
So after seeing Lincoln Clay in Bloodshot, I decided to get back into this.  I have to be honest, I enjoy this, the graphics, the atmosphere, the driving, the music, is all good, even the story IMO.  I also think the protagonist is likeable.   

I also think that the gritty and sometimes racist era is an interesting one to realise.  I don't agree with retconning history to save feelings and I think it's important to be historically accurate.  Being told to leave a bar or restaurant because of how you look is disturbing but also important to the story of Mafia III, a story of a specific era.

In any case, it is sometimes repetitive, but I am willing to get through that to see the next cut scene.  Sometimes I go all stealth and sometimes I call in back up and go all guns blazing.  I enjoy this, I see through its floors and enjoy the gun fights and story. 

If you can get this on offer, and you like a good story, or if you enjoy the 60s era like I do, I recommend this, definitely.

review: I do not recommend this game.  It runs likes crap with RX5700xt OC with an I7 8700k OC as well with 16gb 3200mhz ram. The graphics are disgusting and washed out it looks like a PS3 game. There are so many bugs, glitches it's just awful. I thought with the definitive edition they would have fixed everything but no they made the game look worse. it's so blurry and the draw distance is about 5m in front of you. you see cars and buildings popping in. I wanted to like this game but with all the flaws it puts me off it. I've tried so many times over the years to play it but I'm done. Time to uninstall and never to be reinstalled again...

review:
What can I say? Im a big fan of mafia but this one is grafically horrible...

I cant get past the draw distance, the blur and the grain effect.. what is going on? everything past 5meters loses so much quality that it is just so bad, you can actually see the cars pop up details 5meters away from you.
Its like the game is so badly optimised that they are trying to hide it under the blur and really low draw distance.

Ive never seen anything like it. 

I played on max settings, tried different settings to test and changed the graffics, instaled mods to get rid of the blur/grain effect but nothing helps. its just frustating for the price tag.

review:
What a shame.. great story, characters and writing.
Boring... BOOOORING rest of the game. The missions, the driving, the city, the graphics. Just plain boring.

It looks much more like GTA4 than GTA5 - i don't know how they managed it.
To this day it has several bugs like quest giver not talking to you until you restart the game.
Then you have to deal with pretty long loading times... even with high speed SSDs it takes forever to start the game.

I'd like to finish the story, but I can't be bothered - I'll uninstall :(

review:
I always try and give each videogame a fair chance before making a sweeping judgement but Mafia III is a rare exception where I just know that my experience will never improve. After not even one hour, I have already had enough and I can now fully understand where the negative reviews are coming from. 

This game is set in the late 1960's, but the fictional city of New Bordeaux is extremely soulless and generic, and doesn't feel a very good representation of the era unlike its highly immersive predecessors. The visuals are quite bland although the characters and cutscenes are really well produced. 

The driving is absolutely awful, the movement mechanics are wonky as hell and the combat is atrocious. The AI is also laughably bad and despite its 60's setting, every aspect of this game feels like a common open world title we see so often nowadays. The modern UI elements are also completely immersion-killing.

I've always wondered why this game generated so much flak and although I was aware of some fundamental issues and bugs prior, I didn't believe it to be as significant as it is. The story and cinematics appear of a very high standard but the gameplay is pure horrendous in every respect.

The story and cinematics appear of a very high standard but the gameplay is pure horrendous in every respect.", "timestamp_created": 1590169129, "timestamp_updated": 1590169129, "voted_up": false, "votes_up": 13, "votes_funny": 3, "weighted_vote_score": "0.517686903476715088", "comment_count": 0, "steam_purchase": false, "received_for_free": false, "written_during_early_access": false, "primarily_steam_deck": false}

review:
Mafia 3 has a great and engaging story line that is imo ruined by big wig execs that forced Hangar13 to release an unfinished game .   This game could have been so much more with another year of development.  The city itself provides a great canvas for something special but the opportunity gets squandered.  First off, the city is inhabited by lifeless NPC zombies who show no semblance that they are doing their own thing  or are aware of their surroundings (watchdogs and watchdogs 2 provide better examples of how your NPC characters should behave  in a city imo).   Enemy and friendly a.i. (Like in Stones DLC or with the hit squad perk) is flat out atrocious.  They are so dumb that they barely provide resistance  as enemies or assistance as support.  They don't know how to utilize cover or tactics very well nor do they value their lives.  In the Stones DLC I died multiple times trying to revive A.I. Donovan because he would stand out in the open like an idiot and/or shoot in the wrong direction entirely providing no help.  The graphics are nothing to write home about either for the most part as textures often appear muddy and unrefined no matter the setting with suspect lighting and a terrible day/night transition (A modder created a reshade file that made the game look much better than out of the box which I give the devs zero credit for ).

When I heard they were making a "Definitive Edition" I held out hope  they would use that opportunity to fix some of these issues but it appears they did absolutely nothing but include all the DLC.  No noticeable graphical enhancements.  Zero A.I. /NPC improvements(IMO the games biggest fault).  No additions like a desperately needed fast travel system.   Nothing!  Truly a missed opportunity for this game to right some of it's wrongs. 

Despite all these complaints I certainly got my money's worth out of this title and then some .  Fortunately I got this on sale when it was $10 as I would have  been pissed if I had paid a full $60 for it.   The game has a great story and voice acting which influences me to keep playing to see what comes next.  The music is top notch and really helps put you in the time period .  The driving model is solid imo.  The city itself can be beautiful to look at at times (The inhabitants inactivity give the city zero life though).  Gun play is fun enough and game mechanics of dividing up your empire among your partners is a cool concept.  Unfortunately I am often left wondering to myself what could have been with this game if more time was put into it..A real shame..  I would recommend this game only if it is on sale (60%-70% off)
Good clean fun.

review:
Wow, I can't believe people are whining about this update . my 2.8 G , 6 core processor with 16 gig of ram and a 1070 GTX , always ran this game with the odd crash ( driving in the rain ) . Was extremely heavy on my GPU , was getting bad temperatures . Now it runs like a dream , graphics are now optimised for PC .
 My computer by no means is any big rig to brag about ! But I know how to get the best out of it . Many people complaining , I have a big rig with blah blah blah, constantly in the forum and it won't play and I have a big PC this is all bad . If the operator of a computer is clueless , it don;t matter how big your rig ! Always loved this game , even with it's flaws, now its AWESOME !

and yeah, the game's awesome!

review:
Pros: good shooting, driving, and fun features. I never played the previous Mafia games but from what I hear there is a lot of hate on this game. I think the story itself is the best part. Its a story of revenge in a era of racism (more openly than now) and that may throw some people of because its different from the previous stories. As a minority, I relate to the story and maybe thats why I like it.

Cons: small glitches here and there but nothing game breaking.

review: So here goes, I got the definitive edition for free, which means that I got the DLC's for free, I still paid for the base game when it first came out. After playing the base game and now the definitive edition, I want to say that the game has either had not had any noticeable changes to graphics but has suffered a decrease in performance. The game was pretty bad from the start, the graphics were far below industry average and the frame rate was locked at 30fps. Since then the game has seen minimal support in the graphics department and the in performance section. Only being bumped up to 60fps a few weeks / months after release. The game itself is not too bad, worse than Mafia II, which is odd, but still not a bad game. I did enjoy the time that I have put into it so far and there are some great set pieces from time to time. But it is hard to overlook the blurry and at times straight up horrible looking graphics and physics that this game has. As a result I can not recommend Mafia III at anything more than a $9.99 price point assuming that you're also getting all the DLC's that come with the game. Overall score would be around a 5.5/10 just above average and is mainly held down to its poor performance and optimization. The game-play only knocked off about a two points at most.

The game was pretty bad from the start, the graphics were far below industry average and the frame rate was locked at 30fps. Since then the game has seen minimal support in the graphics department and the in performance section. Only being bumped up to 60fps a few weeks / months after release. The game itself is not too bad, worse than Mafia II, which is odd, but still not a bad game. I did enjoy the time that I have put into it so far and there are some great set pieces from time to time. But it is hard to overlook the blurry and at times straight up horrible looking graphics and physics that this game has. review:
Ok, short and to the point. I have gone back to this game many times since i first installed. When it first played it was great, but as the below reviews attest, it was ruined by an update that you couldnt opt out of. Now it appears that 2k have done another update but not advertised it. i still cant run the game at optimal spec, but it no longer displays the message that my computer doesnt have the minimum spec, nor does it need to be run at graphics setting = potato. I would love to recommend this game as i am really beginning to get back in the game, i really feel the characters and story works and that LClay is a genuinely believable character... but... its taken them this long to fix a problem, which they didnt advertize as fixed, it still has to be run at less than medium spec for playable visuals. look, 2k, i did this with wolfenstien new order; if there was a maybe button i would press it, as it was, i paid more than i should have for a broken game which has since been fixed. i havent yet touched the added content and the fact i never opted in to the definitive version makes me think it wasnt worth the bother of the huge download. whatever. see below for original 2 reviews.


This top bit is an update, but it doesn't make much difference. The game is still a negative.
After receiving a series of emails from 2k, which did not address any issues with the game, and throughout they thought i was complaining about problems with a different game, i uninstalled this game. After seeing that a patch had been released i thought i would give it another chance. I was wrong. NOTHING HAS BEEN FIXED. If you view the min spec requirements before the update which caused all the problems, it is compatible with my spec. i could run the game at decent settings, and now it wont run at playable speed even with the graphics set to "POTATO". On the whole i am incredibly disappointed, not only with the promise of a potentially fulfilling game, but with the devs lack of concern when addressing their consumers. There are a number of positive reviews of this game which seem dubious, and none make mention of the game killing update. some guy has over 2000 hours logged. Either he plays no other game, ever, since release, or they are spam reviews. DO NOT BUY THIS GAME. IT IS NOT FIXED YET.

Well it seems like everyone else here has had the same problem as me. I had the game running just fine, just completed the first big mission in the wierd voodoo theme park, then when i went to play again i discovered a MASSIVE 20 odd GB update and now, "oh nice, i have definitive edition" becomes "Oh **** i have a game which is now UNPLAYABLE". i had it running at optimal settings, it now wont even run at the lowest. if a games developer is going to put in a MASSIVE update like this, they should allow people with systems older than 6 months, to opt out of such unwanted things. Extra content, great. GAME WRECKING SYSTEM UPDATE; not so great.

review:
would I recommend .. yes as a game it's fun, No in the current state it is in.

The Game is now unplayable, was playing just before the new "Definative edition" update happened (last week / start of this week) and now the game crashes to desktop after the "continue" or "New Game" loading screens.

a patch needs to happen soon to deal with this.

I really used to like Mafia 3 after the patches and the awful, awful, AWFUL glitches and visual hiccups this game had. Sure, the main gameplay loop was repetitive, but the story was engaging and well written enough for me to keep moving on, the animations were really good and the driving aspect was really enjoyable. Then this joke comes out and screws everything up so hard that it made me do a complete 180¬∫. 

Mafia III Definitive Edition makes justice to its new subtitle with the same quality mirrors work in this game: awfully broken. Not only I've seen old bugs and glitches coming out of this so called Definitive Edition, but NEW ones have been tainting my experience with the game. Cutscenes not loading properly and freezing, random crashing, aiming going crazy if you turn VSync on, and even some controller buttons stop responding whenever the game wants to!! Not only that, but the stupid visual glitches look worse than ever now. Textures don't load at times, mirrors and reflections can't even do something f *u * cking Duke Nukem 3D did in 1996 and the most disgusting part of all: there are NO IMPROVEMENTS whatsoever. NONE.

Sure, you get the season pass and all the 3 missions you can beat each one in less than 1 hour, but do I need to remind you the price of this so called Definitive Edition? It's 30 bucks. For a game that barely holds up and will make you waste more time tweaking settings to make it not look like crap than playing it.

Don't buy this game. The story is fantastic, the combat feels punchy and the weapons and sounds are fantastic, and the driving is really fun, sure, but those are the only aspects that prevent this game from being a complete joke. Instead of a Remake/Remaster/Whatever of the 1st Mafia they should have actually given a crap about properly fixing Mafia 3 issues, not making them come out even worse.

review:
Finished up the game before definitive edition update. I quite enjoyed it overally. The game had it's moments. I've really enjoyed DLC missions and this Donovan character deserves his own expansion/story told goddamn!. You'll know when you play it. There were moments where this game looked amazing (e.g. previously mentioned dlc like nuclear warhead mission/island or driving around towns or throughout the bayou), and it's awful moments dotted here and there. Gameplay loop was repetitive but it wasn't nothing that big of a deal if you played any of the bigger block buster open-world titles like recent Assasin's Creed. This is nothing that you would be angry about. Be warned AI of your enemies in this game is so stupid. Played the game on medium difficulty setting and could've play it as well on hard. Most of the times you can easily funnel waves of enemies into one entrance and mow them down with ease. If you go about silent approach to cleaning up areas of enemies that you have to conquer you can do it easily with throwing knives and no one is the wiser, apart from maybe the last guy in his office where he chats with his subordinate (which he sometimes shoots bcs of quarrel and being on the edge). Don't worry about driving recklessly around cops/cop cars - as long as you don't crash into other cars or run over people you are golden. 
The atmosphere is great and one liners being thrown about or the things that happened during that game time felt like a interactive Quentin Tarantino movies. Cops harrasing people, cigarettes being good for you or occasional beer commercial where father figure is trying to convince a minor that this beer is amazing and one day he'll love it along with all the other stuff men like to do like picking up girls, driving fast cars and shooting guns. You know them good ol' days before any of that SJW and political correctness bullcrap was introduced and spoiled the fun for everyone.
 OST is amazing and gets you into the mood of after/during vietnam war times. And for me personally that's one of the pillars that make a game memorable. On this point they delivered.
Graphic wise it looks alright to get the job done. I come from times where gameplay and story was much more important while graphic fidelity gaps were filled by your imagination. Not that these graphics lack that much. So this is ok.
Gameplay is enjoyable. Shooting people, driving cars and your interaction with the environment (albeit indestructible stonewall bushes that you can crash your car over with can kick you out of immersion quicker than angry parents waking up to find out that you are still sitting in front of your PC at 4 in the morning and you have some important school stuff to do in few hours - let he who is without sin cast the first stone :P) is alright. 
Story is OK I guess. A circle of we're getting there to millions, we are betrayed and need to have revenge.

Don't know why ppl are angry about it being a shit game. I liked it. Game crashed about 5 times throughout the full playthrough (which took about 42 hours). Had to reload to last checkpoint from time to time when approaching a quest giver bcs they wouldnt react to bumps/talking interactions or sometimes the animations for characters that were to do something around lincoln didnt kick in but simple load last checkpoint (which 100% times was just before the thing that didnt work in the first place) fixed it for me. I guess I must be one of those guys that seem to have a rather stable setup that works well and don't give me any grief.
 
I wish there was graded and more complicated scoring system rather than bland 0 / 1 that steam has now. 
By any means everything I've written down in here is my personal opinion and taste. I've enjoyed my time with this game and if you like games about driving cars, shooting bad guys and being a sort of anti-hero but with his own moral compass/value system/things that drive you forward this a title for you. If you like GTA this game will be like getting into a cheaper version of your favourite "go to town" boots that you will probably use to do stuff around your garden or home and will not have many/almost any qualms about.

TL;DR - This is a cheap GTA game that has it's flaws, lacks diamond shine polish but it's not a bad game. IT's a Average to Good title. Strong 7 out of 10. But not by standards currently employed by $hit "journalist" scale that were bought and paid for. I'm talking about common sense and logic driven scale. Without any bias of any sort, I've bought it for myself on sale. Be smart with your expenses and life choices, buy it on sale (like everything else) and never pre order stuff. Read reviews, watch somegameplay, ask about opinions  of other ppl and then decide. But most of all never ever get swayed by the mass telling you what to think or how to feel about stuff. Decide for yourself. 

P.S. Thing that I really wonder about :
WTF did that almost 15 GB definitive edition update added to the game? I've turned it the game after update and no visible changes (5 min check). Graphic wise it changed literallly nothing for me. And I've played it on high quality settings.
I want a list of things added/modified like a patch log. Smells like a bad cash grab, just place a new sticker on top of the old title and sell the same dated stuff with a newly released game price tag. Something smells fishy in here.

P.S.2 : This game has NO MOTORCYCLE DRIVING of ANY sort. In fact there are no bikes, motorbikes or anything like that anywhere in the game (or maybe there is something like that standing as a easter egg or I've just missed it whilst it was standing like a barn in the middle of grass field... but oh well).
Feels bad man. Wanted to put that MC club attire and drive around on my indian chief while being a bad ass. But no bueno.
Devs add some bike riding to your next game (or even to this one :P). Driving cars is fun but I prefer more agile, faster, loads more dangerous two wheel ride.

review:
One of the most under-rated games of the decade! 

After all the negative reviews the whole world put together for MAFIA III, decided to give the game a try. The developers have solved pretty much all the 'glitches' and 'technical issues'. 

Personally did not experience any trouble. 

As far as the game is concerned - THE STORY IS MAGNIFICENT. 

The main character, Lincoln, feels like an aggressive bull with Agent 47-Like stealth abilities (IMO). Yes, missions and objectives do feel similar but the versatility is in your own hands - YOU can choose different approaches - STEALTH, SNIPING, GUN-FIGHTS etc for every mission/task. 

Its an open-world Crime Shooter, so if you expect it to be similar to GTA with next-level attention to detail, it wont be. If you liked MAFIA II, you will love this too. Different districts with signature rackets (giving you insight into the crime world of 1960's America), Side missions that increase your earning abilities & emotionally dense story missions - Taking over the city one-by-one feels really rewarding.

Good Guns - CHECK. 
Good Cars - CHECK.
Boss Moments - CHECK. 
Vast Open World - CHECK. 

Would love to see the developers shine with MAFIA's definitive edition or probably take all the criticism and deliver a master-piece with MAFIA IV.

review:
This game has a serviceable story with interesting characters.
At some point it gets repetitive to get the districs and just a few different missions here and there, plus the listening devices to collect which are plenty.

The driving is well done, many people complain but they don't know anything about cars nor history, back then the tires were having less traction and the ABS system was not a thing, pus all the cars were heavier in full metal, which make them behave like a rock with lot of inertia.

In general it is a good game but the best in terms of story is MAfia1
