review:
Despite the fact I'm persisting with this game, I don't recommend anyone purchase this in its current state.

Having bought the original MAFIA III, was quite happy with the game so far. However the forced "upgrade" to the Definitive Edition has actually been a step backwards. A 25% drop in frame rates and graphical glitches have made this a frustrating experience. The only reason I am persisting with this title is that I'm so deep into the game, but if you're thinking of buying this game, even on sale, please reconsider until there are updates that fix these issues. 

As for the game itself, its fun but incredibly repetitive. The characters you have to take out are forgettable, along with their stores and the mission structure goes as follows:

* Meet with someone to start mission
* Take out a couple of hench men at a few sites
* Visit a few sites and either rob them or destroy their stash of whatever it is.
* Once you've done the above, the boss location will unlock where you have to kill them

Every single mission is structured this way. 

Furthermore, there's no real upgrade system and no ability to see stats. Therefore the game lacks depth and to be honest, once I complete I'll probably never play it again.

tl;dr - Don't buy this until there's a patch/fix. And even so, buy it if you're extremely bored as its inferior and repetitive in many ways.

review:
This game has received  a lot of poor reception, mostly due to the performance of the games launch back in October of 2017, since this date, the game has received it's Definitive Edition update which has granted all DLC to all owners of Mafia 3 along with a tiny overhaul, and many bug fixes. As of 5/20/2020, this game runs smoothly. 

In terms of it's story, some parts can be redundant, but I enjoyed my time when I first got the game (Maybe 2018), and am enjoying my current replay with it's DE release. I would suggest getting this game on a 25% or higher sale.

Very Fun.

Good game. Doesn't deserve all the hate. It's not your typical Mafia game since it is not linear as the previus ones and it doesn't feel like Mafia series if you're not in the 40s, but it is a very solid third person shooter,. It is as much repetitive as you want it to be, since you don't need to do every single mission they put in front of you. I found it to be less repetitrive than the likes of Assassin Creed Origins, but again, in these games you don't need to complete every single side quest unless you want to.  Not as story rich as Mafia I & II but story is not bad at all, and they did a terrific job with the setting. It really feels like you are in the 60s where racism was around every corner.. 7.5/10

review:
Going through my second playthrough. 60 hours on my last one!

The update works beautifully for me. The game hadn't worked previously on my new setup and now it does. 

The storyline is great. You properly feel for Clay, and find his struggle real. It's a great game and well worth it.

Pretty decent game series, had fun playing all of them (despite not completing this one currently)

Despite recommending this game, a few things really bug me. There is a bug in this game that hasn't even been looked at by the developers and the only fix seems to be to wait and the game works it out itself (over a few REAL days) or by downloading someone elses save game to copy over your own.

Ammo crates and certain other in-game destructibles that you are required to destroy to progress in story missions are indestructible, meaning you can't complete some missions.

The game has small issues things like random stuttering and hitching, a 60Hz refresh rate cap that can only be removed with modification, and many in-game glitches.

But the game is not bad at all, really solid story, and world, especially since it is now part of the Mafia Definitive Collection, you get all the DLC with the initial game purchase. 

Highly recommended, just use PCGamingWiki to iron out some of the bugs first.

I really enjoyed the past releases of this franchise. After my initial disappointment with Mafia 3, I tried to give the game a second chance.

It's not an engaging, at least in my opinion & very repetitive. There's a lot of games out there that are more worthy of your time.

review:
Due to lack of optimization, with updates not being patches but clusters of memory leaks, this game is unplayable.

Edit: If it wasn't for the bad optimisation, this game would be one of the few actual games out there in the last 10 years.

review:
Take-Two and 2K games have updated all their games Terms of Service, turning this game as well as all of their other games into literal spyware.

Collected Data Types:
‚Ä¢ Identifiers / Contact Information: Name, user name, gamertag, postal and email address, phone number, unique IDs, mobile device ID, platform ID, gaming service ID, advertising ID (IDFA, Android ID) and IP address
‚Ä¢ Protected Characteristics: Age and gender
‚Ä¢ Commercial Information: Purchase and usage history and preferences, including gameplay information
‚Ä¢ Billing Information: Payment information (credit / debit card information) and shipping address
‚Ä¢ Internet / Electronic Activity: Web / app browsing and gameplay information related to the Services; information about your online interaction(s) with the Services or our advertising; and details about the games and platforms you use and other information related to installed applications
‚Ä¢ Device and Usage Data: Device type, software and hardware details, language settings, browser type and version, operating system, and information about how users use and interact with the Services (e.g., content viewed, pages visited, clicks, scrolls)
‚Ä¢ Profile Inferences: Inferences made from your information and web activity to help create a personalized profile so we can identify goods and services that may be of interest
‚Ä¢ Audio / Visual Information: Account photos, images, and avatars, audio information via chat features and functionality, and gameplay recordings and video footage (such as when you participate in playtesting)
‚Ä¢ Sensitive Information: Precise location information (if you allow the Services to collect your location), account credentials (user name and password), and contents of communications via chat features and functionality.

review:
when i bought this game i was excited. but when i started to play it i was like is this the game i just bought??
I have never seen such laggy mess of a game this game feels like it could been out years ago because nothing is optimized sure i dont have the best gaming pc but it should run it at least at 40 Fps. So i thought hey lets crank down the graphic to extreme levels. i spent 27 hours not seeing anything just guessing and getting headaches after headaches because i need to focus so much. I would not spent a Dime on this game its like Homefront the new one but worse. So dont buy this game unless its free but be prepared to be dissapointed because this is a mess. I dont understand how they fucked Mafia 3 up this much like Mafia 1 amazing Mafia 2 very good. Then came Mafia 3 a massive downgrade. I think Mafia 2 looks better then Mafia 3. and Mafia 2 plays better

review:
Update: Latest Patch seems to have a made a difference in Frametime and FPS. But now the game has more bugs like the Car not moving when the race starts, radio change sound effect looping continuously, engine sounds glitching. Of course crashes to desktop while reduced aren't gone and expect to see them now and again.

BUT! If your looking for a game to transport you completely to another era then this game is it - despite the bugs and technical issues. Gunplay and cover system is solid too.

review:
God this game is a joke. I really want to enjoy the story but these bugs and ugly graphics won't let me to do it!!
After this game got a small update to Defintive Edition, there is no fixes for this game. Only thing i notice is, season pass is free for Mafia 3 Original owners but it's useless to me since i didn't finish the main game and i am not going to because how mess this game is !! 
This is worst AAA game i've ever played. RIP 2K CZECH. Hangar 13 is a joke and i'll never buy anything from this company! 
Glad i didn't pre order this game, i was very close to pre-order it and gladly i waited for user reviews. 
I bought this game years later from Humble Bundle (good deal), i should have sell the key. I didn't expect that this game is going to be very bad.

Edit: I gave another chance to this game and i finally finished this game. It's really badly optimized and 100% CPU when driving in big area. But honestly, the story is masterpiece and i enjoyed it a lot. Mini main missions are really boring, like it's repetitive and it got me bored fast. I had to rush when i've played these missions. Main missions are really good and enjoyable. But honestly AI is s h i t. I headshoted them when they were standing and hiding, it was too easy to kill them. And it's really buggy but mostly there are a lot of graphical bugs, i haven't seen any similiar bugs like falling out from map, being stuck or other bug missions (maybe only one and i had to restart checkpoint) and like anyone experienced this issue. Maybe they are fixed but i'm not sure. 
Still, this game isn't even worth $5, maybe it's worth for less money but it depends if u have a good computer, it won't be good on your shitty laptop that runs low requirements. It has to be above of your requirements.
Since Definitive Edition offered free DLC's, i don't fucking care. Also Ending was really good but still. I want 20-40s Mafia games and hopefully Mafia 1 Remake is going to be good. Please don't pre-order anything from Hangar 13 (I miss 2K Czech, Mafia 2 was successful on launch)

{"recommendationid": "69476962", "author": {"steamid": "76561198039749196", "num_games_owned": 0, "num_reviews": 113, "playtime_forever": 1541, "playtime_last_two_weeks": 0, "playtime_at_review": 452, "last_played": 1600555736}, "language": "english", "review": "God this game is a joke. I really want to enjoy the story but these bugs and ugly graphics won't let me to do it!!
After this game got a small update to Defintive Edition, there is no fixes for this game. Only thing i notice is, season pass is free for Mafia 3 Original owners but it's useless to me since i didn't finish the main game and i am not going to because how mess this game is !! 
This is worst AAA game i've ever played. RIP 2K CZECH. Hangar 13 is a joke and i'll never buy anything from this company! 
Glad i didn't pre order this game, i was very close to pre-order it and gladly i waited for user reviews. 
I bought this game years later from Humble Bundle (good deal), i should have sell the key. I didn't expect that this game is going to be very bad.

Edit: I gave another chance to this game and i finally finished this game. It's really badly optimized and 100% CPU when driving in big area. But honestly, the story is masterpiece and i enjoyed it a lot. Mini main missions are really boring, like it's repetitive and it got me bored fast. I had to rush when i've played these missions. Main missions are really good and enjoyable. But honestly AI is s h i t. I headshoted them when they were standing and hiding, it was too easy to kill them. And it's really buggy but mostly there are a lot of graphical bugs, i haven't seen any similiar bugs like falling out from map, being stuck or other bug missions (maybe only one and i had to restart checkpoint) and like anyone experienced this issue. Maybe they are fixed but i'm not sure. 
Still, this game isn't even worth $5, maybe it's worth for less money but it depends if u have a good computer, it won't be good on your shitty laptop that runs low requirements. It has to be above of your requirements.
Since Definitive Edition offered free DLC's, i don't fucking care. Also Ending was really good but still. I want 20-40s Mafia games and hopefully Mafia 1 Remake is going to be good. review: These Reviews are partly true, so I've tested this on my System (i5 3570k & GTX 1060 AORUS), and it feels still kinda chubby, also many Bugs as before are still a part of this Game, sadly. The FPS I get, is around 50 - 60 FPS on Ultra and 60 - 80 FPS on Low (First Mission), although, it's too less for an old Game. I hope they'll fix it in the future, so the Game is more enjoyable, like Mafia II. I've pre-Ordered Mafia I: DE and I hope it won't have a bad start like Mafia III before. Just purchase Mafia III: DE, just if you A) like old time Games and B) if you already have two, or even three Games of the trilogy in your library, to get a discount on the Bundle, as I did. I had Mafia I & Mafia II before, so, I got an additional 10 Bucks discount for the "Trilogy Bundle".

review:
Just like the original Mafia III, this game is so blurry at 1080p it hurts your head. It helps a little bit to turn down the Anti-Aliasing, but there's no way to turn it off completely. ReShade can help, but even it can't completely get rid of the blur. I'm still mad I wasted money on the original Mafia III, even after being given this re-release for free.

Oh, and this "Definitive Edition" seems to just be the original Mafia III with all of the DLC included. The game even uses the same settings files from the original Mafia III.

review:
The 'Definitive' edition of Mafia 3 did nothing but give me potato graphics making it look awful. Frame rate that was previously fine (sitting at around 60 on max settings) now drops to around 30 even when switching to the lower settings.  Really frustrating that this was an update that was forced down our throats without the option to stick with the classic version. I get that it was a nice thing to give us all the 'Definitive' edition for free but really there should be an option for this kid of thing in the future. Now instead of enjoying the game most of us have to wait for a patch so we can get back to playing. 

Looking to buy this? Wait till the first few patches come out to fix the s**t they broke.

First things first, If you've played Mafia 2 and expect a story-focused sequel, you'll have to drastically lower your expectations. There is no comparing the two. And there is no point in denying the critic brought to the repetitiveness and plainness of the story.

HOWEVER, if you understand this before going in, you'll find that the game is pretty damn fun and satisfying to play. Finding creative ways to take down rackets (which you'll do A LOT) keeps it interesting. Also, the DLCs are a great addition, since they help kill the repetitiveness of the base game. Also, the soundtrack of this game is absolutely beautiful. I swear, sometimes I start playing just to listen to CCR while driving.

Overall, this game is pretty fun to play, albeit the story is pretty meh.

Oh, also, GET READY FOR SOME BUGS, BOIS.

review:
Mafia III is well , "itz what it itz" type of game. Let me explain, the game has rather interesting story many weapons and the gameplay is good, i think. But there is the other side, and it is filled. It can be said in one word     one word "boring" after getting to the Burke's part of town it becomes so boring and repetetive that I am surprised I have managed to play till the end. Second of all are those bugs and it's not those little bugs, no I am talking about quests not completing on map or unpickable items. Well, would I recommend this game? Yes, but only for die-hard fans of this franchise.


6/10

Wait you guys just did a reralease of the game and just gave it and mafia 2 plus the dlc for free ? now that is how to treat your community i never played mafia 1 but i deffently gonna be picking it up now this here mafia 3 was avrage it had its problems but the fact they will go out of there way to remaster it but just give it away for free is something i didnt expect to see.

I thought long and hard about what recommendation to give this game. I really liked the story and the storytelling. The city was ok, and the right atmosphere was created by the music and people‚Äôs reactions to you. I could overlook its shortcomings if it had any other name. As a Mafia game, this is, to put it mildly and politely, subpar. Even the first game had better handling, more interaction and a more believable world and game mechanics. The second game in the series was one of the best games ever made. This is in almost every way inferior to that, a huge step backwards. It had the potential to be great, but in my opinion it failed. The world is really opened up for the first time, but that only leads to repetition and a ton of cash and hardly anything to spend it on.
If you want a cool action piece with a nice story and setting, go for it. Do the absolute minimum to get you to the next objective, and you will have a great time. If you expect it to be anything like the first two games or plan to do everything, then it will let you down.

review:
I first tried playing this game around release but I couldn't get over the technical messes I'd hit at every corner. Lighting was over-exposed, glitches were constant, pop in occurred in literally every frame, and if I did find any sort of groove then the game was sure to crash. 

However, this hasn't much been the case with the "Definitive Edition." While this "Definitive Edition" does NOT deserve the title of a remaster, it certainly gets a few things right. In the last few hours I've spent with the game I've been enjoying myself. It seems as though the lighting has been toned down, pop in occurs at a subjectively acceptable distance, and I have yet to experience any crashes. My biggest gripe at the moment would be the frame rate, which even at medium settings hovers around 30-45fps @ 1440p on a rx580. On the flip side, the world and soundtrack in this game is top-tier. The guns feel punchy and the driving feels meaty. However, this doesn't change the fact that the game is brazenly repetitious. The first hour or two is excellent and expertly paced. Unfortunately, it doesn't take long for this to crumble for you to realize it's quickly becoming "go here, kill him, drive here, talk to her, drive here, kill him." Admittedly, this is the situation many modern open world games find themselves in; which is a topic for another time. If you're a fan of the 1960's and it's culture, solid gun-play, stealth, or weighty driving, then this game is for you. Bearing in mind you can look past the repetitious nature that has plagued modern open world games.

review:
Don't listen to "this is not mafia" widows and the "too repetitive" nay-sayers. This is a damn good open world game with a solid story and strong historical context. Graphics (reshade is a must!) and soundtrack are amazing as well, very true to the era. You'll be doing yourself a solid by playing it. You guys are gonna go nuts with the collectibles in this game. Wait for a sale!

edit. to solve stuttering and go above 60fps, install reshade then overwrite the dxgi.dll file with the custom one you can find on pcgamingwiki

I bought Mafia 3 again when i got a decent PC and i realise again why  i love this game and i can forgive some of it's minor downfalls.

review: Bought during sale the classic edition but later on freely upgraded to the definitive edition, now the thing is the update came along with a significant drop in my fps. Apart from that the its sad to say that the game is full of bugs and the missions seem the same old repetitive thing which can easily bored a person. It's good that the definitive edition comes with all the DLCs which I assume should have been free at the first place (it was not free at the before the definitive edition). And along with the new price tag if you are not buying the game on sale at a cheaper price it won't be worth it. I was so much excited when the update came and I became much happier to know that I would get all the DLCs, but the happiness went away all with the fps drop

review:
I beat this game without buying it... Played through the free weekend event. Thanks Steam!

I do like everything about this game, story, voices, music, graphic, etc etc... but only one bad thing about it that missions are just more of the same, over and over again in different theme and location. Honestly, that's the only worst part about it. I see a lot of bad reviews being unfair and picky.

Because I rushed through this game on a weekend... it really does looks like it's something I can truly enjoy if I had taken the time with the world and do some side quests and racing.

review: Definitely a different style of game from the last 2 but if you don't enjoy this style of gameplay then you can simply replay the first 2 games. I find the punisher-ish storyline very well acted and compelling. Running around growing your criminal empire is icing on the cake. Not as well executed as the first 2 titles but still a lot of fun to be had. Also I appreciate them giving me the Definitive edition for free as an upgrade.

review:
Most soulless mafia game ever made. Main story was boring, main character also not that great...missions poorly done. A lot of useless extended boring repetitive missions over and over again. 
Honestly I wouldn't call this game even mafia game because its not even close to originals Mafia 1 and Mafia 2. Its like developers created amazing world but forgot to add heart to it. 
You should better wait for Mafia 1 total remake in Mafia 2 engine and stay away from it.
